Dalia had a special education in the sports domain, and is enjoying her business very much. Today, she runs her business from a friend's gym, where she has her own customers whom she serves during the afternoon.

She is working hard to develop her career and hopes to open her own gym in the future. Currently she is focusing on the surgery that she has to undergo for which she has requested a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. She is looking forward to go back to her training classes very soon.

loans.use: To pay for surgery and medication.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
He is 59 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He has been in business for more than 20 years and his monthly income is KES 20,000. He has borrowed money to buy seeds and fertilizers. This is his first loan with Vision Fund Kenya.

The anticipated profits he gets will be used to pay school fees. His hopes and dreams in future are to live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 73 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, estudio hasta segundo grado tuvo 12 hijos pero actualmente solo uno vive con el.

Benito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres además tiene otras fuentes de dinero a través de la siembra de sandía, actualmente siembra una manzana de terreno también tiene 11 columnas la cual le permite obtener producción de miel de abeja su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 12:00 PM.

El dinero del crédito principalmente lo utilizara para cancelar la tierra donde cultiva maíz y el resto para la compra de la semilla y herbicidas para preparar la tierra y compra de fertilizantes y otra parte para la siembra de las plantas de sandía que tiene en el vivero.

Sus planes a futuro es siempre de dedicarse a la agricultura darle el estudio a su hijo de 17 años para que pueda realizar el bachillerato y darle un buen ejemplo a seguir de una persona luchadora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Benito is 73 years old. He lives with his life's companion. He went to school up to the second grade. He has 12 children but right now only one lives with him. 

Benito works mainly as a farmer. He learned the work from his parents. He also has other sources of income through growing watermelon. Right now he has one plot planted with 11 rows. This allows him to produce honey. His work schedule is from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM.

The money from the loan will be used mainly to pay for the land where she grows corn and the rest will be to buy seeds and herbicide to prepare the soil and buy fertilizer. Another part will be to plant the watermelon plants that he has in the nursery. 

His plans for the future are to work in farming and give his 17 year old and education so that he can go to college. He also wants to provide a good example by continuing to be a person who is hardworking and a fighter.

loans.use: to pay for the land where he grows corn and the rest is to pay for seeds and herbicide to prepare the soil and buy fertilizer. Another part of it will be to plant watermelon plants he has growing in the nursery.

loans.name: María Maritza

texts.es:
María tiene 24 años de edad, estudió bachillerato a distancia, ella no se dedica a ningún trabajo solo a los oficios del hogar, su compañero de vida trabaja en el destacamento militar como soldado, y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un hijo que no va a la escuela, la cliente no hace ningún trabajo pues depende directamente del esposo.
 La cliente necesita el dinero para el pago de jornal y compra de abono y fertilizantes , pues su esposo a pesar de sus trabajo cultiva maíz y frijol. 
Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional y tener una casa mejor  también ella piensa en poner un negocio, esto lo piensa lograr trabajando con los créditos de CREDICAMPO, pues el dinero que obtienen lo invierten en los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old. She studied her bachillerato (high school qualification) via distance learning. She doesn't have a job; she only works doing the household chores. Because of this she depends directly on her partner, who works in a military detachment as a soldier and in agriculture in his spare time. She has a son who doesn't go to school.

She needs the money to pay a daily wage and to buy manure and fertilizer, as her husband grows corn and beans on top of his job. 

Her dreams are that her son become a professional and to have a better house. She is also thinking of starting a business, which she hopes to achieve with CREDICAMPO loans. The money she receives will be invested in family expenses.

loans.use: to pay a daily wage and to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has been earning income from a transportation service for many years. In addition to also earning income from her farm, she has been able to sustain other business that brings income to her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor accessories. 

To improve her farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, Rosa hopes to support her child's education and to provide her with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
Isela estudio hasta bachillerato general, tiene 20 años y esta soltera, hace dos años trabajo para una empresa en la cual su madre ya lleva 10 años trabajando oara esa misma empresa, actualmente vive con su mama y sus hermanos pequeños, ella aporta de sus ingresos segun las necesidades del hogar.

Isela luego que termino sus estudios de bachillerato tomo la decisión de ayudarle a su madre con los gastos de la casa ya que su padre murió hace varios años  y solo su madre le tocaba trabajar para llevar el sustento de la familia.  Isela tiene 2 años de realizar este trabajo el horario de trabajo de Isela es de 7:00 am hasta 5:00 pm la empresa les brinda el transporte. Su lugar de trabajo está a 30 minutos en bus.

El préstamo lo utilizara para construir el techo a la casa que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han  construido de 2 plantas, comprará polines, hierro, lamina y cancelaran la mano de obra a la persona que le realice este trabajo. 

Los sueños de Isela y su madre son seguir trabajando para la misma empresa y luego de terminar el techo de la casa comenzar a mejorar el piso de la misma y su meta principal es poderla terminar completa para vivir ella su mama y hermanos en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Isela has a secondary school education. She is 20 years old and single. Two years ago, she started working for a company where her mother has already been working for 10 years. She currently lives with her mother and her younger siblings. She contributes with her income according to the needs of the household. 

After finishing high school, Isela decided to help her mother with the household expenses, since her father died several years ago, and her mother had to work alone to provide the family's support. Isela has been working for 2 years, and her working hours are 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The company provides transportation. Her workplace is 30 minutes away by bus. 

She will use the loan to construct a roof for the 2-story house that they have built with great effort and hard work. She will buy beams, metal, and flat plates, and also pay for the labor of the person who will carry out this work. 

The dreams of Isela and her mother are to keep working for the same company, and after they complete the roof of their house, to begin improving its floor. Their main goal is to be able to complete the house so that Isela, her mother and her siblings can live under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy beams, metal and flat plates to put a roof on her house, and to pay for labor to carry out this work.

loans.name: José Hernán

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela porque su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, actualmente él está casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tienen 1 hijo de 2 años.

José es agricultor, además aprendió el oficio de albañilería, ahora él siembra14,000 mts de maíz, el cual está a 500 mts de su vivienda.


El crédito será invertido para comprar los  insumos agrícolas para la producción de maíz.


Él sueña con poder tener un pequeño hato ganadero, para no solo depender de la agricultura, además mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 43 years old, didn't have the opportunity to go to school because his family had scarce economic resources. He is now married to a housewife, with whom he has one two-year-old son.

José is a farmer, and has also learned the construction trade, and now sows 14,000mts of corn, 500m from his house.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of agricultural supplies for the production of corn.

His dream is to have a small herd of livestock, so that he doesn't have to depend only on agriculture, and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the production of corn.

loans.name: Jose Sain

texts.es:
Jose tiene 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos asisten a la escuela.

El tiene cinco años de trabajar como seguridad para una empresa privada, además se dedica a la agricultura  trabajo que aprendió de su padre el cual le permite obtener los granos básicos para el sustento de su familia.

El credito específicamente lo utilizara para realizar la instalación eléctrica de su vivienda el cual comprara, cable, poliducto, caja térmica en conductores y toma corriente la otra parte del dinero para cancelar a la persona que hará el trabajo.

Su sueño a futuro es tener una casa en perfectas condiciones y que cuente con los servicios básicos para brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old. He went to school through the sixth grade. He is married and has three children. Only two of them are in school. 

He has been working in security for a private business for 5 years. He is also a farmer, which he learned from his father. This allows him to obtain basic grains to support his family.

He will use the loan specifically to install electrical wiring in his house. To do this, he will buy wires, tubing, an insulated box for connectors and an outlet. Another part of the loan will be used to pay the person who will do the work. 

His dream for the future is to have his house be in perfect condition and to have basic services so he can offer his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to install electrical wiring in his house. He will buy wire, tubes, an insulation box for connectors and an outlet. The other part of the money will be to pay the person who does the work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to once again help her coffee crop

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Marry, who is married with three schooling daughters, is in her mid-thirties. She has been a running fruit and vegetable business for eight years now. Marry is also a hairstylist when she is at home. She opens her business from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.

This will not be her first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans which she has paid back successfully, to buy more fruit and vegetables. Marry manages to resell her business stock safely and she believe that with this business, she will have a place to sleep (nice house) and greatly improve her life. She used the returns from the business to buy a plot of land where she started building. Marry covered also school fees and home food expenses. She will use this loan to buy stock for her genge (a grocery stall).  

Marry will share this loan with her loan group ”Prado” which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. She also used her loan in her direct selling business. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. She will also use her loan in her variety store. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
Chandy, aged 34, is a hardworking entrepreneur who works farming rice in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has been doing this for nearly 15 years, and earns well for her family. The income generated from the current business, Chandy used for daily foods, clothes, school allowances and other commodities.

This will be her third loan with Hattha Kaksekar. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she is requesting an additional loan to buy a piece of farmland to expand the area for farming rice. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income to renovate her house and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland to expand the area for farming rice.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-two-year-old married male who  lives in Kasese with three children of whom two go to school. He has a textile shop on a busy street and also does farming to get additional income. 

Moses wants to develop himself and needs money to buy shirts, school bags, trousers, dresses and baby wear. Moses is a hard working man who faces the challenge of competition.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as shirts, school bags, trousers, dresses and baby wear to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es un joven  emprendedor que ha estudiado bachillerato, está soltero y actualmente vive con sus padres y aporta en lo que puede a los gastos del hogar.


Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó el padre, el lugar le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos  y él viaja a pie Carlos también trabaja con una máquina para desgranar maíz que es de la comunidad.


Este préstamo lo necesita para cultivar dos hectáreas de maíz, también comprará 6 sacos de abono para echarle al cultivo, esto le ayudará mucho ya que comprará de una sola vez lo que utilizará en la siembra.

Él sueña con tener su propia máquina desgranadora de maíz, y seguir adelante con sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, enterprising 22-year-old who studied his bachillerato (high school qualification). He is single and currently lives with his parents and contributes what he can towards the household expenses.

Carlos has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old. His father showed him how to do this work. His work is 20 minutes away and he travels there on foot. Carlos also works with a machine for shucking corn, which belongs to the community.

He needs this loan to cultivate two hectares of corn. He will also buy 6 sacks of manure to use for the crops. This will help him a lot as he will buy everything that he will use for the sowing all at once.

He dreams of having his own corn shucking machine, and of continuing with his studies at university.

loans.use: to cultivate two hectares of corn.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman with five children. Two of her kids still attend school which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

Florence has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past twelve years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils.

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es:
Luis tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando y le ayudan a su padre en en tiempo libre.
Luis se dedica  a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió desde quera muy joven y es la mejor herencia que su padre le ha regalado. El siembra, maíz, maicillo y frijol. El lugar donde el cultiva está a una distancia de 25 minutos caminando, su hijo mayor le ayuda en este trabajo los fines de semana. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12.00 pm pero muchas veces realiza otras jornadas por la tarde.
El préstamo lo utilizara para preparar la tierra para sembrar, para comprar los herbicidas y fertilizantes necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha y pagar a otras personas para que le ayuden a realizar la siembra y el pago del alquiler de la tierra.
su sueño es seguir cultivando cada vez más, incrementara sus ventas, darle estudio a sus hijos para que encuentren un trabajo formal que les permita obtener todas las prestaciones de ley  y con las ganancias obtenidas de las cosechas ahorrar para una nueva siembra de  frijoles, maicillo y maíz.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old. He studied until third grade, he is married and has four children. His children are at school and in their spare time they help their parents.

Luis works in agriculture. He learnt this when he was very young and it is the best legacy his father has given him. He plants corn, sorghum, and beans. His plantation is located at a walking distance of 25 minutes from his home and his oldest son helps him at the weekends. His daily schedule is from 6:00 a. m. until 12 p. m., but often he does other jobs in the afternoon.

He will use the loan to prepare the land for planting, to buy herbicides and fertilizers which he needs to obtain a good harvest, to pay people to help him with the crop, and to pay the rent on the land.

It is his dream to continue growing his crop, to increase his sales, and to enable his children to go to school so that they can find a formal job and get all legal benefits. With the earnings from his crops he wants to save for a new season of beans, sorghum, and corn.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting, to buy the herbicides and fertilizers he needs to obtain a good harvest, to pay people who help him with the crop, and to pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe grows and harvest rice, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works on their own farm since it is the only way they have to move the family forward. She went with him to the fields where she oversees her crops. 

Mariefe is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement. In the future, she wants to have a better house where her family lives comfortably. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Felestus

texts.en: Felestus is a 35-year-old married female with three children, all of whom attend school. Felestus has a produce business, plus she farms and sells secondhand clothes for additional income. Felestus is asking for money to buy beans to supply to schools and hotels. Felestus hopes to educate her children and build a permanent house, despite the challenges of climate change and competition from other vendors.

loans.use: to buy beans to supply to schools and hotels.

loans.name: Maly

texts.en:
Maly is 42 years old and married with two children – one is married and the other is still in school. Maly lives with her family in the Puk Ruessei Leu village in the Kandal province. To make a living, Maly has been involved in the agricultural sector, primarily farming rice and seasonal crops, which are harvested and sold in the local markets. Farming is her major source of income.
	
Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program that offers a special rate, Maly is encouraged to instill healthy living conditions, safeguard her family's health and protect the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Antehwe We Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single with no dependent family members.  She was born in late 1962 in Teshie, Ghana. For nineteen years now, she has been engaged in cooking local food (banku, kenkey, fish, stew and soup).  Elizabeth works from 7 am to 10 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Elizabeth is requesting her sixth loan from ID-Ghana. With her previous loans (all of which she repaid successfully) she was able to make good use of these loans. With the increased income, Elizabeth invested her profit back into her work and has saved a substantial amount with ID-Ghana for household food expenses. She dreams of expanding her business. Elizabeth will use this loan to replenish her business with new stock. 

She will share this loan with her colleague, Narkie. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (fried fish, tomatoes, okra, corn and cassava dough) to prepare food and sell to customers.

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.en: Erkinoy is 41-years-old. She is married and brings up three children. Her husband Tuhtaboy is a kind man. Erkinoy has an animal husbandry business. She has run this business for 12 years. Erkinoy feeds cattle for months and then her husband sells these cattle in a local market. They also grow maize and sell maize in a local market. Erkinoy now needs a new cowshed because she does not have good conditions for feeding cattle. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, bricks, soil, etc. for building a cowshed. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, bricks, soil, etc. for building a cowshed

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ellos y se encuentran estudiando.

Miguel es agricultor, trabajo  que aprendió de su padre desde quera muy pequeño ya que el no estudio y solamente se ha dedicado a trabajar, Miguel tiene otra fuente de ingreso la cual es por temporada ya que dentro de su terreno tiene sembrado arboles de anonas fruto que durante la temporada comercializa en los municipios vecinos. El lugar donde cultiva esta a una distancia de 30 minutos a pie pero ellos tienen 2 caballos con los cuales les permite llegar en menos tiempo, su hijo le ayuda y el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 12.00 MD.

El préstamo lo utilizara para preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz, para la compra de herbicidas y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha y para contratar algunas personas que le ayuden a sembrar. La necesidad que será satisfecha es el tener el capital necesario para comenzar con los trabajos del cultivo.

El sueño de Miguel es brindarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos para que ellos puedan salir adelante y que encuentren un trabajo que les permita tener todas las prestaciones de ley. Además seguir cultivando para garantizar el sustento diario para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 46 years old, he studied until second grade, he is married and his wife does the household chores. They have three children, but only two of them live with the parents and they go to school.

Miguel is a farmer, he learnt this from his father when he was very small. He did not study a lot and put all his efforts into his work, therefore he does not have any other source of income. His work is seasonal, because on his land he has planted sugar-apple trees and during the season he sells the fruits in the neighboring municipalities. Miguel's plantation is located at a walking distance of 30 minutes from his home, but the family has two horses, so they can get there in less time. Miguel's working hours are 6:00 a. m. to 12:00 p. m. and his son helps him.

He will use the loan to prepare the land for the planting of corn, to buy herbicides and fertilizers to get a good harvest, and to hire help for the sowing. He needs money to start his plantation.

It is Miguel’s dream to enable his children to go to university, so that they get ahead and find a job with full legal benefits. In addition, he wants to continue with his crop in order to ensure a livelihood to his family.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing corn, to buy herbicides and fertilizers in order to get a good harvest, and to hire help for the sowing.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama mujeres valientes, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y por medio de ese esfuerzo poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fatima, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando por medio del trabajo que viene haciendo y por medio de las ventas en su despensa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y lucha viene mejorando su vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y demás para la venta en su despensa, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The group is called mujeres valientes (brave women) and they are all women who head their families. They got together to help each other and, in doing so, to help their families. They are part of the stamp out poverty programme, one of whose members is Fatima. In her most recent survey, her level of poverty was in level three, which means that she has been improving her situation through the work that she has been doing and through the sales from her shop. She is a very hardworking woman who, through effort and determination, is managing to improve her life. She is seeking this loan to buy various items for sale such as drinks, bread, vegetables, fruit and other things to sell in her shop.  This will help her to fulfil her business plan, which will then help her to increase her income.

loans.use: Comprar bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y demás

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married with four children and helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  

She has been harvesting and selling bananas and she earns well to support their needs. She also had a large cow and she personally takes care of it and will sell it in the future. 

To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy fertilizer.  She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Monika, an African mother of three children, is taking care of her family since she has been divorced from her husband. Her cafe is the only business Monika is depending on to meet her family's needs. Her project was planned to be restaurant, but it failed to reach the expected target. Later, she replaced it with a cafe, selling fresh milk, juices, sodas and tea with snacks. She believes that, with loan support from Kiva, her business will grow with enough capital to serve more customers. She starts her business from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

Monika is requesting a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan (which she repaid back successfully) to grow her business with more new stocks (bought take-away soft drinks), and bought a gas stove and flasks for keeping tea and milk. She managed to make a profit, which she used to pay school fees and home food expenses. 

Monika will use this loan to grow her service; buy water, soft drinks and packet milk; and pay for electrical and rent charges. In the coming years, she would like to expand more her business. 

Monika will share this loan with her loan group, "NORWAY," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to grow her service; buy water, soft drinks and packet milk; and pay for electrical and rent charges.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
Eunice, who is in her 20s, is married with two children, and all of them go to school. She has been running a soft drinks and foodstuffs business for six years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Eunice's sixth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase her soft drinks and foodstuff business, and has repaid all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, and bought a wardrobe and sofa set. She will use this loan to buy soft drinks and foodstuffs. She dreams of building her own house.

Eunice will share this loan with her loan group "Adjorman," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and foodstuffs to sell to customers

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está iniciando su comité con el 1er ciclo y están con bastante expectativas ya que por medio de las capacitaciones podrán ir mejorando sus vidas, y ayudando a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una persona digna de destacar es Aurora, quien se dedica a la confección, es una costurera muy buena que siempre deja muy conformes a sus clientes ya que hace muy buenos trabajos. Aurora poco a poco se abrió camino y ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre le trae trabajos para hacer. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia, mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás, para poder seguir con sus confecciones, y así cumplir con el pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group San Miguel is starting their communal banking committee with their first loan cycle and they are very hopeful since through the training offered they will be able to improve their lives and help their families through their work.

One person worthy of mention is Aurora, who works as a seamstress.  She is very good and always leaves her customers happy since she does such good work.  Aurora has little by little made progress and now she has a well-defined customer base that always brings her work.  Her dream is to be able to have a large business so that she will be able to continue helping her family and improving her living conditions.  

She is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of fabric, yarn, elastic, zippers, and other items in order to continue with her sewing and thus complete the requests of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, yarn, elastic, zippers, and other items.

loans.name: Tamanno

texts.en:
Tamanno is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Tamanno is going to start her own business, and in this way, get ahead in life. She is going to organize a business in sewing because she has enough experience in sewing. Tamanno is going to provide service to her clients in her house. 

Tamanno, with this aim, took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" in the women's organization and got a lot of new information for herself. She hopes her business will go well. 

She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business

loans.name: Adiba

texts.en:
Adiba is a kind woman from a rural area. She is widowed and brings up two children. Her children are schoolboys. Adiba is a business lady. She began her business deal after the death of her husband because she needed to earn money. Adiba has successfully run her business for six years. 

She sells fruits and vegetables in a local market. Adiba sells apples, pears, apricots, etc. Adiba offers fresh fruits to her customers every day. She likes her job. People every day eat fresh fruits, so there is a great demand for fruits in the local market. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy fruits to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fruits to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer in order to be able to study.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is 26 years old, hardworking and dedicated to the business she started 10 years ago. She is married and has two children. She is a farmer and has been raising potatoes and wheat. She chose this business because it is profitable and her fresh crops and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy.

Guljahon sells wheat and potatoes in the local market. Her husband actively helps her to raise wheat and potatoes. Also she has an additional business involving animal husbandry, which she wants to expand. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar was born in 1967. She is widowed. Her husband died some years ago because he was ill. Munavar lives with her two children and daughter-in-law. 

She has been busy with a sewing business for more than 20 years. Munavar is an experienced sewer and has her regular clients. Her clients are pleased by her activity. Munavar now needs financial support because her sewing machine has broken. Munavar is asking for a loan of 5000 TJK to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hai Grp Group

texts.en:
Amosi is a married father of two school-age sons. Since 2000 he has earned his living by managing a general store. He opens his shop from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Amosi’s first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. He is applying for 9,000,000 TZS to be apportioned among HAI, his five-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Amosi will use his portion to replenish his shop with new inventory. His ambition is to greatly improve his business.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with new inventory.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 50-year-old married woman. She deals in a business selling cloth. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar, age 47, is a married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika was born in 1971. She is a married parent of four children. She is a very responsible person, and always tries for the well-being of her children.

Malika started a business 10 years ago with the aim of earning a living. She has a café. Her café is located in a local market. She cooks pies, sambusa, ‘kurotob’, etc. Many sellers in the local market eat her cookies. Her working day begins at 7 o’clock in the morning every day. 

She works hard, and tries to offer tasty foods for her customers. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. 

She is going to repair her house, as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is married with two children, and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation of the bunches of green bananas. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation and start growing green bananas. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Nuran

texts.en:
Nuran has one child. She ran her own children's clothing business. However, she had to leave the business since it was not doing well. Now, she is working in another shop with her sister and is still selling children’s wear in this shop. She has a calm, responsible and hardworking personality. Her husband works in a different city, so she lives with her child. 

She wants to receive a loan to be able to sell women’s clothing as well. Nuran, who has a strong desire to be successful and achieve her goal, wants to progress with her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Nuran Hanım,1 çocuk annesi.  Daha önce çocuk giyimi üzerine mağazası varmış, ancak işlerinin kötü gitmesi sebebiyle mağazasını kapatmak zorunda kalmıştır.  Şimdi ablası ile aynı butikte çalışan Nuran Hanım, çocuk giyim satışını buradan yapıyor.  Uyumlu, sakin ve çalışkan bir yapıya sahiptir.  Eşi başka bir şehirde  çalışan Nuran Hanım çocuğu ile birlikte yaşıyor.  Bu kredi ile bayan giyimi üzerine de satış yapmak istiyor. Başarmak ve daha iyi kazanç sağlamak için yola çıkan Nuran Hanım hayallerini gerçekleştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing to sell

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and lives with her children and her husband, who works as a mason. For the past 13 years, Diana has been running a shop at the market selling second-hand clothing, sheets and curtains to support her family. She is the featured borrower of a four-member loan group that lives in Teshie-Accra. In the picture she is standing on the left.

Diana is requesting a loan to buy a better quality and greater variety of items to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. The other members sell soft drinks, fish and provisions.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and greater variety of towels, curtains and second-hand clothing to sell at the market.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to earn extra income.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 46-year-old vigorous lady and has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, age 33, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling clothes. She has been running this business for the past eight years to contribute to the family income. She purchases a variety of clothes in different colors and designs from the wholesale market. She has become popular in her community. 

In order to cater to the demand of her customers consistently, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). It will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different colors and sizes by taking into account the taste and choices of her customers. Tahira expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for a period of about two years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) through Kashf Foundation.  

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 52-year-old married woman. A year ago, she started providing services of cooking in her locality. She enjoys making food and has become famous in her town for proving these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends them to the respective places.  

She needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. Currently, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy a stock of flour, rice and baking powder, along with packs of oil and salt at lower rates from the market. It would enable her to inflate her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. Amna wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, rice and baking powder, along with packs of oil and salt.

loans.name: Kevini

texts.en:
Kevini is married, with six children, who all go to school. She lives in her husband's house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

She has a business selling smoked fish and has been doing this for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of smoked fish. She generates additional income from rental houses and from a restaurant. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenge includes transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of smoked fish.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 27 years old, and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has a son who is 2 years old. Her husband is a policeman at the Military Police. Ruzanna has higher education of pedagogue, but she never worked as a teacher. Despite her young age, she is a very successful business lady. 

She works in her own shop where she sells women's and men's clothes of different fashions and styles. She has run her business already for four years. She brings her shop’s merchandise from Yerevan city wholesale markets twice in a month. 

Ruzanna needs this loan in order to buy a nice and stylish summer season clothes collection, such as women's dresses, and women's and men's trousers and jeans.

loans.use: to buy a nice and stylish summer season clothes collection, such as women's dresses, and women's and men's trousers and jeans.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. Despite having a medical education and a very useful, even the most important profession of a nurse, Liana is engaged in a clothes trading business. She has been in this business 14 years and during that period, Kiva and Nor Horizon have been the best partners for her. This deal will be her third one with Kiva lenders. 

She sells women's, men's and children's clothes, and also women's shoes, at a Ijevan wholesale market. Thanks to her business, she bought for her husband a truck, and he also has his small business of fruit and vegetable sales. As she says, thanks to her and her husband’s businesses, they manage to take care of their two children, who are already students, and provide their family with good living conditions. 

Liana asks for this loan being sure that she will manage to have the same success in her business as during the previous two loans. She asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy summer season clothes, since they are already in great demand in her city.

loans.use: to buy summer season clothes since they are already in great demand in her city

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Dilijan city with his family. He has two school-aged children. Tigran works for the Dilijan Mineral Water factory as a delivery man. His work is the only income for his family. Tigran’s wife is unemployed and takes care of their children. Tigran uses his own car to make the deliveries. Lately it has not been working properly, and this causes problems.

He asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to buy tools to repair his car. He thanks beforehand all Kiva lenders for this support, which he really needs.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair his car, which he uses in his work as a delivery man.

loans.name: Kangogo

texts.en:
Kangogo is 41 years old, married and has six children. He has borrowed a loan to buy more dairy cows to rear for milk production. With the anticipated profits he gets, he will purchase animal food and provide health.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. His hopes and dreams in the future are to have many cows for sale and get enough basic needs for his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a 33-year-old married male with two children; one attends school.  He has been a teacher by professional for nine years, and likes his profession. 

Semu wants money to buy materials like sand and cement to build his family house, as he hopes to improve their standard of living.  

He says long distance is a challenge.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand and cement to build his family house.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda, age 42 years, is married and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose operates a tailoring business, making suits for both men and women. Her challenge in the business is seasonality, but she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for the business.

loans.name: Farhia

texts.en:
Farhia has operated a retail shop business for the past one year selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Betül

texts.en:
Betül, a mother of two children, runs her own boutique. She first began this business with 40 lira she borrowed from a friend and by selling clothes from home. By selling garments from her home for five years, and with the help of her husband and children, she was able to save enough money to have her own shop. She has been running her own business for two years, and is looking forward to receiving a loan to renovate her shop and include children’s and menswear in her product range. As a woman who is open to changes, she wants to advance her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Betül Hanım, 2 çocuk annesi ve butik işletiyor.  Arkadaşından aldığı 40 TL ile evden çamaşır satmaya başladı. 5 sene gibi bir süre evden satış yapan Betül Hanım elde ettiği birikimle, eşinin ve çocuklarının desteğini de alarak butiğini açtı.  2 senedir abiye ve spor kıyafetler satan Betül Hanım  kullanacağı kredilerle butiğini yenileyerek ve büyüterek , erkek ve çocuk giyimi ile ürün çeşitliliğini fazlalaştırmak istiyor. Yeniliklere açık olan Betül Hanım hedeflerini daha da ileri götürerek kazancını arttırmak için çalışıyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Greda, which is made up of three members. They are responsible parents with three children in total under their care. They are from Teshie, which is located in the Greater-Accra region. They are hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to study towards a degree and they had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.

Naomi is the featured borrower of this group. She sells vegetables and supplies like detergent. She dedicates 12 hours per day to selling products in her business. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business so that she can earn a better income in the near future.

The "Greda" Group is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources. They will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and supplies like detergent

loans.name: Serap

texts.en:
Serap is the mother of two children; both the children are studying.  

Serap used to sell clothes.  After her husband's business failed, their income was not enough to support them.  She started to work for a cleaning company at minimum wage. Their income is insufficient.  The cleaning company has made her take a leave for three months, and the family faces financial problems during this period.  She has to work other jobs to support her family.  She will buy scarves and shawls with the loan she will receive and sell them, so that she can earn money.  She aims to have a higher quality of life by earning more income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Serap Hanım, 2 çocuk annesi ve ticaret yapıyor.  Daha önceleri çeşitli kazak,çamaşır vs satışı yapmaktaydı.  Ancak,eşinin işleri bozulunca gelir yetersiz kaldı.  Temizlik şirketinde çalışmaya başladı.  Askari ücret alıyor ve 2 çocuğunu okuyor.  Gelir yetersiz geliyor.  Temizlik şirketide 3 ay izine çıkarıyor,çalışmayınca parasal olarak sıkıntıya düşüyor.  Bütün bunlar başka işler yapmasını gerektiriyor.  Ancak,sermaye sıkıntısı nedeniyle,iş yapamıyor.  Bu krediyle,eşarp ve yemeni alıp satacak.  Gelir elde edecek.  Daha çok para kazanıp,yaşam kalitesini arttırmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy scarves and shawls

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi has two children. She started a business to help her husband when his business was not doing well. Sevgi says they had really bad times in the past. She contributes to the family budget, prioritizing her children’s education, by selling garments like underwear and sleepwear. She enjoys working a lot, and she is a very social person. She also does babysitting. 

With the new loan she will receive, she wants to increase the diversity of her products and raise her earnings. In the future, she wants to own her own boutique.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.
 
Sevgi Hanım,2 çocuk annesi.  Bu işe eşinin işleri kötü gitmeye başlayınca ona destek olmak için başladı.   Geçmişte çok sıkıntılar çektiğini söyleyen Sevgi Hanım, evde  bayan günlerinde, akraba toplantılarında çamaşır ve pijama satışı yaparak, çocuklarının eğitimlerini önceliklerinden olduğunu söyleyerek aile bütçesine katkıda bulunuyor.  Çalışmayı çok seven ve sosyal biri olan Sevgi Hanım çocuk bakıcılığı da yapıyor.  Aldığı kredilerle çeşitlerini çoğaltıp, satışlarından iyi bir kazanç elde etmek isteyen Sevgi Hanım ileride kendi butiğini açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
This is SHG (A) group of 10 members. In spring and summer these hardworking women joined hands to support themselves through loan facilities. They belong to a Kuki tribal community in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. It is about a 40 km drive from the main city of Imphal. 

Chinneithem is the featured member pictured with raised hand. She is 40 years old and a mother to two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a cultivator by profession. Her older son is in pre-secondary and the younger son and daughter are in high school.
 
Prior to shifting to the present village, Chinneithem and her family lived in an interior and remote village. Unfortunately, one day her younger son fell seriously ill and since the village lacked medical facilities and easy means of transportation, they were forced to leave the village to find better amenities for their survival in a new village that is nearer to the main town of Imphal. 

Since there is no other source to generate income in the family apart from the paddy field, in order to supplement the family income Chinneithem started a business using her weaving expertise. She weaves three to four wrap-around skirts every month and sells them for 2,500 to 3,000 INR. With the first loan of 5,000 INR, she bought the required materials like yarn and weaving tools to start the business and she used the little amount left for her children’s education. 

Like every mother, her dream is to give a good education to her children so they can get decent careers. Chinneithem is very happy and content because her effort is not being wasted. Her children are very brilliant and studious; they are her hope and therefore she gives her best effort raising them to become somebody in the future. 

Now, Chinneithem needs another loan to continue her weaving activities. She will use the loan to buy more yarns of different qualities and colors to increase the production of traditional wrap-around skirts for her business. Likewise, the rest of the group members needed the loan to upgrade their respective business undertakings. Weaving, vegetable vending and tea stall are the primary activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy yarns of varied colors and texture to weave traditional garments.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has 5 calves and 2 cows, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.

Naseem has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow.

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a 23-year-old differently able man who lives with his father, mother, sister and a brother in a small village of the Koraput district of Odisha, India. 

Rama has been engaged in a light and sound service (in India, it is called "tent house service") for the last five years. Cureently he makes a profit of 2,000 INR per month. His father is a farmer who helps Rama with his business.

Rama is a very responsible and hardworking man. He wants to expand his business, and that is why he requested a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase the latest sound mixing machine and the latest lighting devices.

He is very happy and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase the latest sound mixing machine and the latest lighting devices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Las Afortunadas Group

texts.es:
15 son las integrantes de este grupo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren capacitarse para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo y los nuevos conocimientos y métodos que vayan aprendiendo por medio de esas capacitaciones. Ellas además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Rommy es una de las integrantes, quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 1, lo que quiere decir que debe mejorar, todo esto por medio de su esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, por medio de la venta de prendas variadas que sale a vender de manera ambulante desde muy tempranas horas.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser camisas, remeras, jeans, camisillas, y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are 15 members in this group who are mothers and heads of family. They want to be empowered to be able to improve their living conditions through their work and the new knowledge and methods that they learn in their training. They are also participating in the Poverty Stopwatch survey.

Rommy is one of the members who in her first survey had a poverty level of 1, which means improvements needed. By way of her efforts and continual work and the application of the vital comportment of a successful woman she has been improving her living situation. She has been selling a variety of clothing starting early in the morning and going out into the streets to sell. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing for resale such as shirts, T-shirts, jeans, tank tops and others, so she can continue with her sales and improve the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale like shirts, T-shirts, jeans, tank tops, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase toiletries and soaps

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. She is a widow and she has two sons. The elder one is already married and he lives separately with his family, so Naira lives with her smaller son.

Naira graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute Faculty of Mathematics. Now she works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. She also gives private courses at her house and she has 20 pupils. She is a strict teacher but she is always ready to help and explain if something is unclear for her pupils.

She asks a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and also some professional literature for her private courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some professional literature for her private courses

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is only 27 years old and he already has great achievements in sport, especially in wrestling. He graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute Faculty of Physical Exercises and Physical Training. Now he works at the school as a teacher of physical exercises and at the same time he is a wrestling coach at the Vanadzor Children and Youth Sports Center.

He took part in many wrestling competitions in our republic and also abroad and he has many medals and diplomas. Now he does his best to teach his pupils and he always says that this sport demands great concentration and prediction, so during the game the wrestler must be so attentive that he must forecast the next step of his rival.

Vladimir is not married and he lives with his parents in Stepanavan city, which is in Lori region.  He asks for this loan in order to buy a computer, which will allow him to be aware of any international wrestling competitions and any news in the world connected with this sport.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Ishkhan

texts.en:
Ishkhan is 30 years old and he lives in Dilijan city with his mother and son. His mother works at the city central post office. His brother is constructor.

For some time Ishkhan was busy with farming and cattle breeding. Then he did construction work. Since 2012 he has worked at the Dilijan National Park as an inspector. It is a very nice park that is rich with nature, where you can find rare and unique types of trees. This park is highly visited by tourists and by the people who want just want to admire the nature and breathe that beneficial and salubrious air. So Ishkhan here watches not to allow anyone to pollute, to tear off or to graze on the grass and flowers that are in this park. 

Ishkhan works very far from his house and he spends much time on the way to reach the park, so he needs this loan in order to buy a car. He drives very well and so it will be very comfortable for him to go to work by car.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in the village Sevkar in the Tavush region. He lives here with his wife and three children. 

For 20 years, Gagik has been busy with farming and agriculture. He used to work as a locksmith, then he was a contractual military serviceman, but now he has no other occupation, except farming, in which his elder son and wife help him. 

On his farm, Gagik has a cow, three bulls, a calf, five sheep, two pigs and ten chickens. Thanks to his hard work around the farm, he manages to sell pork, mutton, milk, and eggs. 

Also, in his car, driving about Ijevan City, he sells the fruits and vegetables of his land, such as potatoes, greens, onions, apples, plums, and figs. 

Gagik greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle, so he asks for this loan in order to buy a bull, three pigs, and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a bull, three pigs, and animal fodder.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 35 years old. She lives with her father in Kapan City, in the Syunik region. Lilit is not married. She graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute. 

Now, Lilit works in the educational sphere and, at the same time, she gives private courses of biology and she prepares the pupils to successfully pass the entrance examinations. She is a very clever and interesting person and pupils like her way of teaching very much. Lilit says that, nowadays, without a computer, man cannot work, no matter what specialist he is and what profession he has. 

Lilit asks for this loan in order to buy a computer and also some literature connected with biology, in which she has a great need.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some literature connected with biology.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Damaris wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, soft drinks.

loans.name: Sadah

texts.en:
Sadah appreciates the previous loan, which helped her to boost her work. In addition, she sells food consumables in her shop. 

Here again, Sadah comes to you requesting a loan of KES 30,000, to buy rice, beans, biscuits, sweets, and bread to sell through her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, biscuits, sweets, and bread to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rameswari

texts.en:
Rameswari is a 24-year-old divorced lady who lives with her parents and her one daughter in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She has taken a divorce for her personal reasons.

Rameswari is engaged in tailoring activity. Her father is a farmer engaged in paddy and vegetable cultivation, and he helps her to purchases materials of tailoring like threads and cloth from the market. Rameswari earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity and she is the only regular earning person of her family. 

She wants to open a tailoring training center so that she can earn more to better support her family. Rameswari has applied for a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase a new sewing machine, threads and other necessary items for tailoring. She hopes to build a house for her family and wants to educate her daughter.

She is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, threads and other necessary items for tailoring.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a 32-year-old divorced lady who lives with her father, mother and two children in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She decided to take divorce from her husband before two years for her personal reasons. She is mother of a son and a daughter and both the children are in  school.

Parbati is engaged in a small food and tea stall where she serves breakfast, snacks, tea, etc. to the customers. She makes a monthly income of 4,000 INR. Her current earning is not sufficient for her monthly family expenses as her children are studying and that incurs additional expense.

Now Parbati wants to enhance her business and make more profit. She requested a loan of 10,000 INR to purchase a gas stove and raw material for food making. She has a dream to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for food making and a gas stove.

loans.name: Barikidi

texts.en:
Barikidi is a 35-year-old divorced lady who lives in a village of Koraput district of Odisha state, India, with her sister, brother-in-law and two sons. Her sons are in school.

She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. After taking a divorce from her husband more than ten years ago, she started a food stall and she is continuing this business and makes a profit of 3,000 INR per month. She wants to expand her business and is looking for financial help. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a rack, a fridge and raw materials for food making.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind support.She hopes to build a house for her family and make her sons successful in their life.

loans.use: to purchase a rack, a fridge and raw materials for food making.

loans.name: Jamini Ranjan

texts.en:
Jamini Ranjan is a 48-year-old differently able man who lives with his wife and a son in a small village of Odisha, India. He owns a betel shop near his house and earns 3,000 INR per month. His wife is a homemaker who is also engaged in vegetable and paddy cultivation, and she helps him in his business. His family income is only 4,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for monthly household expenses. 

Jamini Ranjan has a plan to add more cosmetic items, basic household items, cold drinks and egg stock in his betel shop and also wants to repair his shop cabin so he can fulfill the demands of customers and can make a reasonable profit. 

He has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR to purchase cosmetic items, basic household items, cold drinks and egg stock for his betel shop. He hopes after this investment he would be able to make a profit of 8,000 to 10,000 INR per month.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic items, basic household items, cold drinks and egg stock for his betel shop.

loans.name: Raghunath

texts.en:
Raghunath is a 30-year-old differently able person. He lives with his wife and four children. He is a responsible man and is determined to do well in his business to support his family.

He has a small grocery store in his village for which he pays a monthly rent of 500 INR. He is selling food items like rice, lentils, biscuits, toothpaste, bathing soap and spices. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market to get more stock. He wants to reinvest in his grocery store so that he can stock more inventory at his shop to meet the demands of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying costs. He says that buying in bulk will allow him to avoid his frequent travel to buy stock and will help him get the stock at a cheaper price from the wholesaler. This will increase his earning capacity. 

Raghunath has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more of what he is selling right now in order to increase his inventory level. He also wants to add more variety to his existing product line by buying more brands of spices and cooking oil. He says that the presence of more than one brand of an item at his shop will help him reach out to an increased customer base. With the increased cash flow, he is sure he can take good care of his children and give them a good life and education.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items like lentils, rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 57 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has a vocational education. For the past 10 years, Samvel has been working as a tailor at the shoe factory. He is married and has a 24-year-old son who has his own small business. Samvel’s wife is unemployed. He says he is very cheerful person and he loves life very much; he enjoys his every day life and impatiently waits for the day that he will become grandfather. Now Samvel has some problems with his health that disturb him during work. His problems are connected with his heart and arterial blood pressure. Samvel says all his problems are temporary and he surely knows that he will recover which is proof of his great optimism. 

Samvel is requesting a 400,000 AMD loan to have a medical examination and find out more about his problems and also pay for any needed treatment.

loans.use: to have a medical examination, find out more about his problems and pay for any needed treatment

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar is 36 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region and has a big and nice family. Mkhitar has a son and twin daughters who are pretty and cheerful. He has a higher education with a painting specialty, but now he works at the Vanadzor Police station as a police platoon commander or a police captain. Mkhitar does his work with a great sense of duty and devotion. He says that he loves his work but every minute free from his work he hurries to spend with his family. Mkhitar dreams of providing his children with better living conditions so they all will manage to have higher educations. On his off days, Mkhitar also works as driver-deliverer using his own car.

Mkhitar is requesting a loan to buy a computer and desk as a surprise for his children. As he says, he wants his children to be aware of modern technologies and to know how to work with them.

loans.use: to buy a computer and desk as a surprise for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets, plastic chairs and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Greatmore

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Greatmore from Harare. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. For the past year, Greatmore has run a business where she produces clothes. Her main business challenge is frequent power cuts and she ends up using alternatives such as generators which lead to increased cost of production. 

Greatmore is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy fabric for sewing skirts. She says the extra income generated as a result of her loan will allow her to increase output which, in turn, will increase her profits. In the future, Greatmore plans to own a factory with all the necessary equipment for a tailoring business. She is grateful to Kiva for coming on board.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a resident of Kabunga, in the Ntungamo district. He works as a farmer who grows maize and beans. Edward has received previous loans. His dream is to look after his family but he limited by his lack of capital and funds.

Edward is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan to hire labor to clear land to prepare to plant maize and beans. He believes his loan will improve his production and his lifestyle and society.

loans.use: to hire labor to clear his land

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродчон бизнесмен, занимающийся оптовой торговлей. Он проживает в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. В свои 38 лет Муродчон достиг в жизни все сам. У него имеется высшее образование, собственный прибыльный бизнес, а также любимая семья - жена и трое детей. Муродчон и его жена на протяжении 10 лет занимаются оптовой продажей колбасных и сырных изделий. Их торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города. Они в большом количестве закупают колбасу и сыр и затем оптом продают их мелким торговцам. Муродчон целеустремленный человек. Он не хочет стоять на месте и планирует дальше развивать свой бизнес. Для реализации планов Муродчону сейчас необходима большая сумма. Дело в том, что он в дальнейшем собирается привозить больше товара и для их хранения, ему не хватает еще два больших витринных холодильника, которые стоят очень дорого. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить два витринных холодильника, каждый из которых стоит по 2500 долларов. Этот кредит ему действительно важен. Муродчон очень надеется на поддержку кредиторов.
texts.en: Murodjon is a businessman working in retail. He lives in the B. Gafurovski region of the city of Khujand. In his 38 years of life, Murodjon has achieved a lot. He has a higher education, his own profitable business, and a loving family - a wife and three children. He and his wife have been selling sausage and cheese products wholesale for 10 years. They have a shop in the city's main market from which they sell sausage and cheese that they have bought in large quantities to smaller retailers. Murodjon is a goal-oriented man. He doesn't want his business to stagnate, so he is planning how to further develop it. In order to achieve his plans, he needs a large sum of money. He is preparing to bring in more goods and in order to store them, he needs two more large glass-front refrigerators, which are very expensive. Therefore he is requesting a loan in order to buy them for $2,500 dollars each. This loan is very important to him and he hopes for the support of lenders.

loans.use: to buy two glass-front refrigerators for storage of food products

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 40-year-old lady from Kisumu County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in the family and is married to Odhiambo who is a businessman. She has two children who are 21 and 17 years old respectively.

She has a boutique where she sells new clothes and new shoes. She has been operating this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase new clothes at a wholesale price for resale.
