She will use the anticipated profit to start a new business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to  purchase new clothes at a wholesale price for resale.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is single  and operates a service-based business providing transportation in their community to make a living. 

He took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of motor maintenance.  He plans to improve his business by having another motorcycle for rental and transportation services. In the future, Arnel want to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor maintenance

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Абдурахиму 64 года.  Он очень рад, что у него будет возможность расширить  свой бизнес. Он живет в сельской местности, где основной работой является выращивание сельско-хозяйственной культуры и откорм скота.  
     Жена  Абдурахима помогает в ведении хозяйства, дети также помогают им. Но Абдурахим не может сидеть только на попечении детей он и сам помогает детям ухаживать за подрастающими внуками. Он трудолюбивый, позитивный мужчина , которая очень любит свою семью.  После долгой холодной зимы запасы кормов , которые он делал закончились и с наступлением весны потребовалось приобрести дополнительно корма для содержания скота. Так как содержание скота и переработка молока являются основным источником дохода Абдурахима, он не хотел бы продавать свой скот из-за нехватки кормов и тем самым потерять кормильца. Для приобретения необходимого количество кормов Абдурахиму необходим кредит за которым он и обратилась в "Арванд". Он заранее благодарит "Арванд" за  поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdurahim is 64 and lives in a rural area where the primary industries are agriculture and fattening cattle. He is very happy to have the opportunity to expand his business.

Abdurahim's wife and children help him with tasks around the property, but he can't have his children taking care of him entirely, so he himself helps by looking after his growing grandchildren. He is a hardworking, positive man who loves his family very much. After a long, hard winter he has run out of stores of animal feed and with the onset of spring he needs to acquire enough feed for his livestock, since keeping cattle and processing their milk is his primary source of income and he wouldn't want to sell them just because he didn't have enough feed, and in such a way lose his means of earning a living. In order to buy enough feed for his cattle, Abdurahim needs a loan, for which he has turned to Arvand. He thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Member Erika is still working selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to own a store some day. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

Erika is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en Accion está en el 3er ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no tienen proyecto de emprender para poder asi ir aumentando sus ingresos. 
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Mercedes quien se dedica a la Costura, se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo y tiene un taller en su casa, el préstamo que pide lo utiliza para la compra de insumos varios para realizar sus trabajos de confección, como ser telas, hilos, gomas y demás. Su esposo también trabaja, el es mecánico y se dedica a esa actividad también desde hace tiempo, por lo que ambos se ayudan para ir mejorando sus vidas.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres en Accion" group is in their 3rd cycle with the Woman's Entrepreneurial Committee and help each other to progress. The majority of the members have productive activities and those that don't want to learn how to increase their incomes.

One of the members is Mercedes who is a seamstress. She has been doing this for a long time and has a workshop in her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy various supplies to do her sewing such as fabric, thread, glue and other things. Her husband also works. He is a mechanic and has been doing this for a long time. So both of them are working to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre soltero que vela por el bienestar y salud de su madre. Él junto a su hermano son los responsables de los gastos del hogar.
Este hombre trabaja todos los días y solo descansa mediodía los miércoles, su oficio es el transporte de personas en una motocicleta. Se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo ya que todos los días debe liquidarle dinero al dueño de la moto y debe separar dinero para aportar en su casa. Se dedico a este oficio debido a una hernia que le produjo el duro trabajo que tenía antes en el área de la construcción.
Hoy en día desea independizarse y ganar sus propios ingresos, por eso quiere comprar una motocicleta para trabajarla y que de este modo le quede un poco mas de dinero.
Es un hombre soñador y muy dedicado a su madre.
texts.en:
Juan is a single man who looks after the well-being and health of his mother. He along with his brother are responsible for the household expenses. He works every day and only rests at noon on Wednesdays. He works transporting passengers on his motorcycle. He puts a lot of effort into his work as every day he has to pay the owner of the motorcycle and then have money to take home with him. He is doing this work due to a hernia he suffered while doing hard labor in the construction industry where he used to work.

Today he wants to become independent and make his own income. so he wants to buy his own motorcycle to work with and in this way he will make a little more money. He is a man who dreams and one who is very dedicated to his mother.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport passengers.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia Mariluz se dedica al negocio de cafetin,la socia vende tortas, pasteles y cafes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de cafetin.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tortas y pasteles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member Mariluz runs a café where she sells tarts, cakes and coffee.  She has been running her business for a number of years and is doing well.  Her dream is now to extend the café premises.  Mariluz is seeking the loan to buy tarts and cakes. She is happy to be able to obtain the loan and promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: the member is applying for the loan to buy tarts and cakes.

loans.name: Eudiviges Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Eudiviges Margarita se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,ella tiene un pequeño restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Eudiviges Margarita works selling food. She runs a small business where she prepares different dishes like roast chicken, soups, and meat stir-frys. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been doing this for eight years already and business is going very well for her. Her dream is to own a proper restaurant. She is requesting this loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

Eudiviges Margarita is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Cayetano, es un grupo nuevo que tiene todas las esperanzas puestas en poder capacitarse, y de esa forma  ir ayudando a sus familias con el trabajo en conjunto de todas.  Una de estas mujeres es Maria, una persona muy trabajadora, que está luchando por su familia, para poder ayudarles y que tengan todo lo que no pudo tener.
Maria tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja vendiendo y surtiendo a su barrio con todo tipo de productos, como ser comestibles, bebidas, panes y demás. Comenta que se fue haciendo de muy buena clientela ya que la clave es tener siempre muchos productos que ofrecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de panes, verduras, frutas, enlatados, y demás insumos que le permitirá seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo y luchando por ganarse el sustento del día a día.
texts.en: This new group is called the San Cayetano group where everyone has the highest hopes of receiving training which will enable them to help their families through cooperation. one of the women is Maria, a very hard-working person, who gives her all to help her family and give them everything she could not have. Maris has a well-stocked shop where she stocks and sells to local people all kinds of products such as food, drinks, bread and other things. She says that she has built up a good clientele, the key to that being always having a wide variety of goods on offer. She is seeking this loan to buy bread, vegetables, fruit, tinned goods and other products which will enable her to keep working as she has been doing and to work hard to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy bread, vegetables, fruit, tinned goods and other products for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Rosa works running a grocery store. She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been doing this for five years already and business is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Agripina works selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has been doing this for several years and business is going very well for her. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. Her dream is to own a store. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

Agripina is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell for her general store.

Felisa has been in this business for 6 years. Felisa earns additional income  buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Felisa has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of beans, native rice and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, cartons of salt, drinks, and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa es una señora casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales  el menor tiene 20 años  y asiste al colegio, Rosa vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica 2 años a la crianza de cuyes, el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de cuyes para mejorar su negocio y adecuar sus cuyeras, la aspiración de Rosa es poder comprar una casa propia para ahí mismo construir sus cuyeras ya que en la actualidad los tiene donde un familiar, Rosa quiere que no le falte el dinero para el estudio de su hijo.
texts.en: Rosa is a married woman who has 3 children, the youngest of whom is 20 and attends school. Rosa lives with her husband and son. For the past two years she has been raising guinea pigs. The loan will be used to buy guinea pigs to improve her business and adapt her guinea pig enclosures. Her dream is to buy her own home and build her enclosures there. She currently has them at a family member's house. She also wants to have enough money for her son's studies.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Motiana

texts.en:
Motiana is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Motiana has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and items to repair her house (i.e.  iron roofing sheets, nails and bags of cement). 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Motiana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and things to repair her house (i.e. iron roofing sheets, nails and bags of cement)

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini is a 54-year-old married woman with 8 children. She owns and operates a small store to sell items such as lavalava, shirts, make up and souvenirs. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Kuini needs a loan to buy new  equipment, colorful material, T-shirts, and hand-made souvenirs. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and children. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, colorful material, T-shirts, and hand-made souvenirs.

loans.name: Cassandra

texts.en:
Cassandra is an 18-year-old unwed lady with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Cassandra  requests a loan to purchase a large frying pan, a new oven, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar and a spatula. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Cassandra will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a large frying pan, a new oven, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar and a spatula.

loans.name: Maimoaga

texts.en: Maimoaga is a 24-year-old unwed woman who is the mother of three children. She earns a living by farming a small vegetable garden and running a bakery. She has been doing this for the last seven years and is requesting a loan to buy various supplies, including weed killer, a sprayer, a wheelbarrow and, for her bakery, a new stove, tongs, olive oil, a bag of flour, sugar and yeast. She has been a member of SBPD since 2007. Maimoaga will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, a sprayer, a wheelbarrow and, for her bakery. a new stove, tongs, olive oil, a bag of flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Faausuusu

texts.en:
Faausuusu is 55 years old and married with 5 children. 
She has a small garden to grow cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Faausuusu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, insect poison, gloves, sprayers, a wheelbarrow and a shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Faausuusu will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insect poison, gloves, sprayers, a wheelbarrow and a shovel.

loans.name: Falute

texts.en:
Falute is a 24-year-old married woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling baked meat buns in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Falute has requested a loan to purchase a new stove, a bag of flour, sugar, yeast and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. 

 Falute will use her earnings to help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove, a bag of flour, sugar, yeast and plastic bags.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia es una persona muy trabajadora, que esta luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante, tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, lo cual le ha sido muy útil.
Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar verduras, bebidas, enlatados, frutas y demás, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y luchar así por su familia. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ignacia is a hard-working person who is striving to grow and succeed. She has a grocery store in which she works every day from the early hours of the morning. She says that her previous loan was used to stock her business with all kinds of products, which has been very helpful to her.

Today, she is asking for a new loan to buy vegetables, drinks, tinned foods, fruits and other products, which will help her to continue with her sales and so fight for her family. She is grateful for getting this new opportunity, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, drinks, tinned foods, fruits and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, flashlights and stationery to expand her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested  22,000  PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

Susana has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more motorbike spare parts, motor oil, and different kinds of machine spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, onions and rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Washington Estuardo

texts.es: Estuardo tiene 52 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos que asisten al colegio, Estuardo  se dedica hace unos 30 años a la elaboración de queso y su esposa también le ayuda en este negocio,  son tres propietarios de la pequeña fábrica de quesos, ellos tiene 3 empleadas y  pagan arriendo para hacer funcionar su negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de leche y en implementos para hacer e queso, Estuardo aspira tener a su negocio lo más excelente posible, para que siga funcionando, ya que todos los negocios de elaboración de queso están pasando por una prueba de sanidad.
texts.en:
Estuardo is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children, who attend school. Estuardo has been making cheese for about thirty years and his wife helps him with the business. The small cheese factory is owned by three partners. They have three employees and pay rent in order to operate their business.

He will invest this loan in purchasing milk and supplies to make his cheese. Estuardo wants his business to excel as much as possible so that it continues to operate, since all of the cheese-making businesses are currently going through health inspections.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts, palm oil and native rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Thanh Luong 1 Group

texts.en:
Tuyet, 33, is an unmarried Thai woman. She lives with her brother, sister-in-law, and  their three children who attend school. She and her brother and his wife work in agriculture to grow rice, and raise pigs, buffalo, chickens, and plant a vegetable garden. Regardless of their considerable efforts, they face difficulties including the high price of supplies, low price of their products, and  insect issues.

Tuyet said that she had heard a lot about Anh Chi Em Program's activities and she wanted to acquire a loan and training so that she could avoid the damage caused by insects and find the solution for the pricing of products and supplies.

This is her first loan in Anh Chi Em and she will use a portion of the loan to buy chickens and ducks to expand her business. Tuyet hopes that she will be able to afford to move out and live independently. She also dreams of getting married to a good man and raising her children to be successful in a career and life. 

In the picture, Tuyet wears a blue shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
Aura is the President of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Margaritas”, located in Santa María Visitación, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. She is a young 23-year-old single mother of a five-year-old child who is her motivation to succeed on a daily basis. Because she became a teenage mother, Aura was unable to finish school but realized how important education was to a successful life. With the help of her parents and double effort on her part, she continued her studies and now she has a Certificate in Accounting from high school

She began to sell fruit in a nearby park to earn a living and the business is coming along well. Aura is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fruit to meet the increasing demand for it. With a proud voice, she reports that she feels happy alongside her son who is enrolled in school. She wants to provide everything that he needs and she realizes that she has many opportunities to take advantage of.

The ladies of the “Margaritas” Trust Bank are very thankful to obtain their small loans funded by KIVA investors. They learn a great deal from the monthly educational talks given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer on useful and relevant subjects like effective business practices, indebtedness, accounting and budgeting. They also are pleased to learn about women’s rights and self esteem as well as nutrition, health and medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge labels the combination of the non-formal education segment of the meetings and the loans, “Microcredit Plus”. 

We look forward to reporting on the progress of Aura and the other women of the “Margaritas” Trust Bank. Aura has shared with us that she intends to pay her loan back fully and on time. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina  se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos y tambien vende productos de belleza , la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes y zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Ernestina works selling shoes as well as beauty products. She sells lipstick, lotion, and perfume. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a business space where she could sell her beauty supplies. She is requesting this loan to buy lotions, lipsticks, fragrances, and shoes.

Ernestina is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lipsticks, fragrances, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Maria Alicia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende tambien zapatos y ollas, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes,ollas y zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia works selling beauty supplies like lipstick, lotion, and perfume. She also sells pots and shoes. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in business for several years. Her dream is to have a business space where she could sell her beauty supplies. She is requesting this loan to buy lotions, lipsticks, and fragrances, as well as pots and shoes.

Maria Alicia is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lipsticks, and fragrances, as well as pots and shoes.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es un grupo que se destaca por su unión, está en el 6to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de poder crecer y salir adelante, y también ir capacitándose.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dominga, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que en mucho de los indicadores están en un nivel bajo. Ella comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, luchando por sus seres queridos para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Hoy Dominga pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, panificados, verduras, y demás productos para poder surtir su negocio, y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de productos a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo por medio de las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "San Cayetano" group is known for being very close-knit. It is on its sixth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, and its members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to grow, prosper, and learn more in training.

One member of the group is Dominga who, at the last survey, was at level one poverty: this means that she was achieving very low results for all indicators. Dominga tells us that she has a small shop where she works every day from early in the morning. She is fighting for her loved ones in order to give them everything that she could not have.

Today Dominga is applying for this loan in order to to buy drinks, breads, vegetables and other products to stock up her business. She can then continue to offer her customers a good variety of products. Dominga is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing through training.

loans.use: to buy drinks, breads, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Fetafiaina

texts.en:
Fetafiaina is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Fetafiaina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a machete, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar and shovels. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. 

With her profits, Fetafiaina hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a machete, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar and shovels

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn a 30 year old mother of two, has been operating their own farm, while her husband works for a private company. For many years in growing and harvesting coconut and other crops she was able to provide the family.  She had to be determined in her work to augment their situation. In order to enhance her farm she received a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.  Vilma has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested 17,000  PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, meat, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income buying and selling charcoal.  Vilma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old, married, and has four children.  

Delia is in the agricultural business to grow flowers. Delia requested 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pots, fertilizer, and other flowering plants.

Delia has grown flowers for 3 years and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pots, fertilizer, and other flowering plants.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries .  Mary Jane has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Mary Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
Marybeth is 38 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested  25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

Marybeth has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and earns additional income growing vegetables.

Marybeth aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo amd groceries.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is 47 years old and married, with seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Gay is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gay has been pig fattening for 15 years, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cow skin to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and assorted other drinks to sell

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is a 42-year-old married woman with 5 children. She runs a small food stall in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Lisa has requested a loan to buy bowl noodles, coffee, sugar, foam cups, box of noodles and a chest freezer. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lisa will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bowl noodles, coffee, sugar, foam cups, box of noodles and a chest freezer

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa está en su segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 18 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien es vendedoras de comidas varias que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada, y cuenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Liz agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados, verduras y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por un día a día mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is in its second cycle within the women's committee program, through which all the members are committed to working hard and helping each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, which has showed that two of the eighteen women are living below the poverty line. This means they have to keep working in order to improve their living conditions.

Liz is one of the group's members. She is in the food sales business. Every day in the early morning she prepares several food items which she then sells on the street. She is a very dedicated woman and says that everything she does is for the good of her family, to give them everything she wasn't able to have herself.

Liz is greatful for this opportunity and says that she is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in purchasing meat, spices, bread, vegetables, and other products. This will allow her to keep working and fighting for a better day-to-day life for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, bread, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Идигул молодая вдова, ей всего 24 года и уже год как она потеряла мужа. Ее опорой в этой жизни являются ее милые и очаровательные дочки, которым по 3 и 6 лет. Идигул одна воспитывает и обеспечивает их. Благодаря матери еще  в юности она научилась профессии швеи и уже два года как зарабатывает предоставляя услуги швеи. Поначалу для Идигул было очень трудно смириться с потерей близкого ей человека. Но постепенно она пришла в себя и заставила себя жить ради своих девочек, так как никто не может дать ребенку ту любовь, которую ему дает мать.
Идигул принимает заказы на пошив платья у себя дома. Она решила расширить деятельность и берет кредит для приобретения новой вышивальной машинки модели Yamata с профессиональным столиком и стулом. Она очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Idigul is a young 24-year-old widow. It has already been a year since she lost her husband. Her support in this life are her two adorable daughters, ages 3 and 6. 

Idigul educates and provides for them herself. Thanks to her mother, Idigul started to sew in her youth and has already worked as a professional seamstress for two years. 

Initially it was very difficult for Idigul to reconcile with the loss of her beloved husband. But gradually she came back to herself and forced herself to live for her girls, because no one can give a child the love that a mother gives. 

Idigul takes orders to sew dresses at her house. She has decided to grow her business and take a loan to purchase a new embroidery machine (model Yamata) with a professional table and chair. She hopes very much for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine (model Yamata) with a professional table and chair.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 64-year-old woman who is divorced with 3 children. She runs a small store selling a variety of items in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Mary has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, a chest freezer, and a display fridge. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, a chest freezer, and a display fridge.

loans.name: Santa Isabel 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Isabel 2 está en su ciclo número 1° Del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las expectativas puestas en mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ellas también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, lo que les permite conocer que punto deben mejorar.
Lidia es parte de este grupo, ella se define como una excelente vendedora, y está saliendo adelante por medio de la venta de perfumes que hace. Es por medio de las ventas que ha dado a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes y fragancias varias, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. Todas están contentas porque a través de las capacitaciones podrán ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Isabel 2 is in its first cycle of the women's committee programme. It is a new group and they have set their expectations on improving their living conditions and those of their families. They are also taking the poverty elimination survey, allowing them to know what points they should improve.

Lidia is part of this group. She defines herself as an excellent saleswoman, and is getting ahead through her perfume sales. It is through these sales that she has given her family everything that she could not have.

She is asking for this loan to buy perfumes and various fragrances, because that way she can continue with her sales and keep striving to improve her income and that of her family.

They are all are happy because, through the training, they can continue growing.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and various fragrances to sell

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 41 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Rica has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Rica aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc

loans.name: Chaleta

texts.en:
Chaleta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years; she earns more income from motorcycle transport and a buy and sell charcoal business.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell at her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Chaleta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell ready-to-wear products business. 

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, young coconut, etc for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, young coconut, etc

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. Jona works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of noodles, sardines, spices, etc. to sell.

Jona has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of noodles, sardines, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of rice, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling feed.

Letecia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 22 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell through her business, like lotion, body spray, and deodorant.

Kristine has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell through her business, like lotion, body spray, and deodorant.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Victorina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victorina has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lyndel

texts.en:
Lyndel is 27 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, and cream.

Lyndel has been in business for three years. 

In the future, Lyndel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, and cream

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming sugarcane. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 36 years old, married, and the mother of six children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Roselyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

Roselyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ella is 26 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ella has a business, selling seashells in the Philippines. Ella requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more seashells to sell to customers.

Ella has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seashells to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 61 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been pig fattening for 21 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tie dye, lace, and wax cotton cloth for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her medical expenses.

loans.name: El Huarango Group

texts.es:
María, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene un niño de 3 años. Ella es socia del grupo "El Huarango" el cual está formado por seis socios, todos ellos con un negocio diferente.
María se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace aproximadamente cinco años, negocio que realiza en su propio domicilio, gracias a su trabajo ella puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y sobretodo tener una independencia económica. Paralelamente ella trabaja reciclando plásticos, papeles, etc. lo cual también le genera un pequeño ingreso extra.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, and has a 3 year old son. She is a member of the group "El Huarango," which is made up of 6 members, all of them with a different business. For approximately the last five years, María has made a living selling food, running her business out of her own home. Thanks to her work, she can cover her household expenses and above all have economic independence. At the same time she works recycling plastics, papers, etc., which also generates a little extra income for her.

She will use the received loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of the food that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of food that she will sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
After losing her job during the economic crisis, Laura found it difficult to find another. She took her savings and opened her own sewing shop. 

“I decided to do what I do best,” said Laura.

A seamstress with over 20 years of experience, Laura had been working in other industries since arriving in the US from Argentina. But, she always kept her dream of becoming a wedding dress designer. In order to realize her dream, Laura needs money to purchase new garment conveyors and additional equipment to begin sewing wedding dresses.

Help Laura fulfill her dream of being a wedding dress designer and achieve her own financial stability!

loans.use: To purchase new garment conveyors

loans.name: Rakiat

texts.en:
Layo G. is Rakiat’s passion project, as well as her business. A Nigerian transplant by way of London, Rakiat earned a degree from Parsons, The New School of Design, and has been endeavoring to make her mark in the fashion industry ever since. 

She founded Layo G., LLC, and launched her e-commerce site, which helped her to grow her brand and encourage sales. But, she lacked the marketing support she needed to pitch her product to boutiques and fashion publications that could put her brand on the map. 

With this loan, Rakiat will be able to increase her marketing efforts. Help Rakiat increase her brand visibility!

loans.use: To pay for marketing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer, a printer and a camera

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory, born and raised in Haiti, has lived in the United States for eighteen years. He founded Axis Financial & Insurance Group in an effort to provide full “one-stop-shop” insurance to small business owners. 

Though he has landed some major acquisitions for his company, including a commercial property owner with two commercial retail centers, he had difficulty generating leads and new clients. Without a marketing plan and people to implement it, Gregory was struggling to take his business to the next level. 

With this loan, Gregory will be able to increase marketing outreach through the Internet. Help Gregory continue to grow his business and assist small businesses across Florida with their insurance needs!

loans.use: to pay for marketing outreach.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Originally from Panama, Fernando and his wife moved to Miami in search of greater economic opportunity. He saw an opportunity in selling baseball caps, a sport he has always been excited about. 

With this loan, Fernando is looking to grow his inventory while establishing credit as a business owner in the United States. Help this new entrepreneur start his business and provide a better life for himself and his family!

loans.use: To purchase additional baseball caps to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create hair tool prototypes.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангис имеет доброе сердце. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети еще несовершеннолетние. Фарангис более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она шьёт национальные женские одежды. Фарангис шьёт красиво и аккуратно. Благодаря хорошему сервису она имеет постоянных клиентов. Фарангис данное время нуждается новой швейной машинке, так как ее швейная машинка старая. Фарангис также хочет купить ткани для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farangis has a good heart. She is 26 years old and married with two children. Her children are still minors.

For more than two years Farangis has offered her services as a dressmaker. She sews traditional women's clothing. Farangis sews beautifully and precisely. Thanks to her good work, she has regular clients. At this point, she needs a new sewing machine because her machine is old. Farangis would also like to buy fabric to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy the sewing machine and fabric. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is 43 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowela requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowela has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rowela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to rent a food stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is many things – a husband, a father, a homemaker and an artist. He is also the owner of Springfield Satellite Web & Photo. 

“As a homemaker, a photography business gives me the flexibility to provide an income for my family, and also allows me to express myself artistically. It’s been a good combination,” says Eric. 

Eric was always drawn to entertainment photography. After doing much wedding work for close friends and family, he is looking forward to building his brand. In order to do so, he needs to be able to purchase a full sensor DSLR camera. It will give him the opportunity to take his craft to the next level and really express what he sees behind the lens into an experience for his customer.

“With only one income in the household, everything that I can bring in is critical for my family to be able to have the best chance that they can. It makes the difference in my daughter’s education, and it can make the difference between not having groceries or gas at the end of the month.”

loans.use: to upgrade equipment for his photography business.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 48 years old, married, and has four children, one in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernadita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadita has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bernadita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pig feed.

Zenaida has been pig fattening for eight years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Aida has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. Diosdada is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Diosdada has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Darlyn has been in this business for four years. Darlyn earns additional income from a general store.

Darlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional chicken to sell for her business.

Susan has been in this business for five years. Susan earns additional income from pig fattening.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Vergie runs a business direct selling herbal and beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vergie has been in this business for 12 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Fe Presentacion

texts.en:
Fe Presentacion is 64 years old and widowed with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries, rice, liquor, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Fe Presentacion has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Fe Presentacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, rice, liquor, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and plastic bags for the business.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and plastic bags

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 40 years old and married with five children who are in school.  Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc.

Daisy has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba, continua buscando la manera  de tener satisfechos a sus clientes para tener los ingresos que necesita para apoyar en los gastos de su familia y mantener su buen record crediticio, por ello se decidió a solicitar un nuevo financiamiento que le ayudara a realizar la compra de maíz, cal, leña, güisquiles, papayas, mangos, naranjas repollos, cebollas, zanahorias etc.
Con la inversión anterior ofreció frutas y verduras frescas a sus clientes, la producción de tortillas aumento, su familia vive con un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Alba continues to search for ways to satisfy her customers in order to have the income she needs to cover her family's expenses and maintain her good borrowing record. This is why she decided to ask for a new loan which will help her to buy maize, lime, firewood, güisquiles, papayas, mangos, oranges, cabbage, onions, carrots, etc. 

With her last investment, she offered fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers, her tortilla production increased, and her family's lifestyle improved.

loans.use: to buy maize, lime, firewood, güisquiles, papayas, mangos, oranges, cabbage, onion, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Asentamiento Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asentamiento Poty está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Librada, quien todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en su despensa, la cual pudo montar con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, y que poco a poco ha ido mejorando. Librada es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Librada pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, enlatados, bebidas, leche y demás productos para poder surtir su despensa y de esa forma seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The “Poty Settlement” Group has conducted their 4th meeting in the Women's Committee Program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. Work and effort continues within the group. They have carried out a survey concerning the elimination of poverty, and have found that 7 members remain below the poverty line.

One of the members is Mrs. Librada who works every day from very early in her grocery shop, which she began with much sacrifice and effort, and little by little, it has been improving.  Librada is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who struggles for her family, to be able to give them all that she herself could not have.

Librada is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of groceries, including canned goods, drinks, milk and other products to  restock her shop and, in this form, to continue working as she has been, to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy groceries, canned goods, drinks, milk and other products to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра является мастером своего дела.  Она опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 32 года. Она разведенная и не имеет детей. После развода она вернулась в родительский дом. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она более 2 года занимается этим бизнесом. Данное время она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки новой швейной машинки для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayora is a master of her craft. She is an experienced dressmaker, creating masterpieces of traditional Tajik dresses. Sayora is 32 years old, and divorced with no children. 

After her divorce, she returned to live with her parents where she runs her business. Thanks to her good work, she has a wide range of clients. For more than two years she has run her business and now needs a new sewing machine. Her income is not sufficient to purchase a machine, so she is requesting a loan for US$1,000 to expand her working capital. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and increase working capital.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима уроженка района Яван. Ей 41 год. Она занимается животноводством. В течение 4 лет Халима разводит коров и телят. Ей помогает младший сын. У Халимы двое сыновей и одна дочь. Ее муж вместе со старшим сыном сейчас находятся на заработках в России. Все заботы о семье на плечах Халимы, пока она успешно справляется со всем. Сейчас одна корова Халимы беременная и она ждет пополнения в скором времени. В связи с этим Халима хочет запастись кормом для скота, чтобы откармливать корову полноценно для того чтобы в будущем получать хорошее жирное молоко. За счет кредита она хочет купить жмых и люцерну. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Halima is a native of Yavan. She is 41 years old and raises cattle. For four years she has bred cows and calves. She has two sons and one daughter. Her younger son helps her and her older son works in Russia with her husband. 

She is responsible for taking care of the family. One of her cows is pregnant; she expects the addition soon. Because of this, she wants to stock up on food for the cattle, so she can fully fatten it and get good rich milk in the future. With the loan, she wants to buy "cake" and alfalfa. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle: "cake" and alfalfa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer and employ a telemarketing staff.

loans.name: Razvan

texts.en:
Razvan moved to the United States from Romania in 2006. A true business owner at heart, Razvan comes from a family of entrepreneurs who are all self-sufficient from their own endeavors. Razvan himself dreamed of being his own boss and providing jobs for others. 

Razvan saw an opportunity for growth in the trucking industry after talking with friends and studying the inner workings of various large trucking companies, and so he founded Ronexpress Inc. 

Razvan has learned what his brokers and shippers require, allowing him to provide excellent service. However, in order to grow his business he needs to purchase more equipment. With this loan, he will be able to balance the needs of his drivers with various orders from brokers and shippers, allowing him to save money on factoring fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover overhead costs for fulfilling basil orders.

loans.name: Matilde Gilberto

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 52 años de edad, estudio segundo año de educación Básica, actualmente está soltero pues su esposa lo abandonó, solo un hijo y sus padres dependen de él.

Él trabaja en la agricultura lo ha hecho durante toda la vida pero también se dedico unos 20 años a trabajar como albañil.
El lugar donde trabaja la  agricultura le queda a una distancia de 15 kilómetros por lo que tiene que viajar en vehículo   y 
Quedarse por unos tres días y luego regresar a traer comida, eso sucede cada vez que siembran, la limpian , y 
doblan por lo que aprovechan y estando ahí trabajan todo el día. 

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar seis sacos de fertilizantes, semillas para sembrar  maíz y pagará quien le ayude a sembrar. 


Su gran sueño es tener fuerzas para trabajar para seguir cuidando su familia y encontrar un lugar mas cercano para trabajar.
texts.en:
Matilde is 52 years old and has a second grade education.  He is currently single since his wife left him.  His son and parents depend on him for support.

He works as a farmer and has done this all his life, but about 20 years ago he also started working as a mason.

The area where he works as a farmer is 15 km from his home and takes a vehicle there and stays there for three days at a time and then goes home to get food.  This takes place every time they plant, weed, and double up.  They take advantage of this and remain there all day.

He is asking for this loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer, seeds to plant corn, and pay for labor to help him plant.

His great dream is to have the strength to work so he can continue to care for his family and to find a closer place to work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and works hard to support her family. She operates a restaurant in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Elizabeth requested a loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to buy meat, chicken, hotdogs, soft drinks, etc.  In the future, Elizabeth  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, hotdogs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is widowed and works hard to support her family. She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Evelyn requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase sugar, milk, rice, etc. In the future, Evelyn would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  She works very hard to provide for her family. Lucia operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years. 

Lucia requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy soft drinks, rice, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 51 years old and single.

Rosalinda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fish, meat, vegetables and other ingredients for her restaurant business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, meat, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 59 years old, married, and has three children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 40 years. 

Lydia requested her seventh loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional feeds. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is widowed and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Milagros requested a loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy soft drinks, mineral water, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mineral water, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements because winter is approaching and the roof of her house is damaged. She will also invest some of the money in building a retaining wall to hold back rainwater.

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en:
Raghad, a 44-year-old mother of three, is an ambitious, enthusiastic, and motivated Iraqi woman with a keen eye for business opportunities.

Though she holds a diploma in Computer sciences, Raghad could not open a business matching her academic background due to challenges she faced in her conservative community whose restrictions limited her to fields of business traditionally designated for women. Raghad faced the same challenges when she accompanied her husband to work in Libya. But, Raghad’s dynamic personality and eagerness to work helped her rise above these challenges. She taught in kindergartens for five years while she lived in Libya which equipped her with valuable experience and skills.

Building upon her experience and entrepreneurial spirit, Raghad opened a private kindergarten three years ago with very little money and support from her husband. Today, her successful business of six classes employs 12 women and generates enough income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

Her growing business and willingness to learn and develop her business skills qualifies her to participate in the WLIFT program and take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 10,000 USD. Raghad is responding to her clients’ demand and increasing the number of classes; therefore, she plans to completely renovate her kindergarten by building a  second floor and adding a play and exercises hall, thus creating job opportunities for members of her community and extra income to support her family.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue supporting Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to increase the number of classes by completely renovating her kindergarten, building a  second floor and adding a play and exercises hall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean and efficient cooking energy package that uses liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Noong Het 1 Group

texts.en:
Xuan is a 40-year-old Thai woman who was elected as representative of Noong Het 1 Group, which consists of eight Thai ladies. Xuan lives with her husband and her two children in an old Thai traditional house in a small village far from the city center. Her son is 21 years old and is learning to become a car driver while her daughter is 14 years old and is attending very fully secondary school with good study results.

To provide favorable conditions for the children, Xuan has worked very hard in various business and production activities. Indeed, she not only works at agriculture, such as raising chickens, ducks and planting vegetables, but also is dynamic at doing business. Specifically, she is a trader of aquatic products (fish, eel, shrimp, crab, etc.), which helps her a lot in improving her family's income. Together with her in the effort of earning a living, her husband works extra for the local construction employer. Their achievements meet their expectations and endeavors and currently, they can afford to pay completely the tuition fee for their two children as well as buy some furniture for the old house.

Xuan is very grateful to Anh Chi Em because of the support that the program has offered her family since she took out the first loan from here. This is her sixth loan with Anh Chi Em and this time she will use a portion of the loan to buy more aquatic products to sell in the city market. She dreams that her children will be successful in careers and have an abundant life.

In the picture, Xuan wears a Thai traditional costume and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more aquatic products to sell in the city market

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo que está trabajando y luchando por salir adelante, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá crecer y mejorar, además por medio de esta irán aumentando sus ingresos y ayudando a sus familias.
Marina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que a través de la venta de verduras frescas que hace, está saliendo adelante. Comenta que su sueño es poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar verduras frescas para la venta, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, repollos y demás, y así seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a group that is working and striving to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey that will allow them to grow and improve. It will also allow them to keep increasing their incomes and helping their families.

Marina is one of the members of this group. She is a very hardworking woman, and above all entrepreneurial, who, by selling fresh vegetables, is getting ahead. She comments that her dream is to be able to give her family everything that she could not have, and that they not want for anything.

She is asking for this loan because she wants to buy fresh vegetables to sell, like tomatoes, green peppers, onions, cabbages, and more, and thus continue offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green peppers, onions, cabbages, and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Analyn requested a loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Analyn would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 48 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elma has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 56 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Hermenia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 69 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy shampoo, chips, soap, eggs, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, chips, soap, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like sugar, cream, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like sugar, cream, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Kasongodde Twegatte Farmers'group

texts.en:
Eldad, a member of Kasongodde Twegatte Farmer's Group, is a 52-year-old man, married, with eight children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.
