Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de café, taller de cigarros, venta de vidrios, salón de belleza, pastelería, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al apoyar a su madre quien realizaba la venta del mismo producto, pasados los años decide emprenderlo independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá en las comerciantes de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The "Del Valle" communal bank began its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the "Villa Exaltación" field office. It is made up of eight members and led by an executive board of which Señora Soledad is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including coffee sales, a cigar-making shop, window sales, a beauty salon, a pastry shop, food sales, and fruit sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses like the Soledad's. She states that four years ago, she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a fruit-sales business. She reveals that she started this business with the support of her mother, who was selling the same product. As the years passed, she decided to start out on her own.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to purchase fruit at wholesale; she will acquire it from the merchants of the city of El Alto and later sell it in her own sales location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, since she is single and has a son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale

loans.name: Escomeñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESCOMEÑITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de comida, ferretería, venta de frutas, tienda de barrio, venta de pollos, servicio de transporte.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que al empezar a convivir con su pareja deciden seguir realizando el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Escomeñitas" communal bank is starting its third loan cycle at the Achacachi regional office of "Pro Mujer". The group has eight members, and is run by a board of directors that has Amalia as its president. The members have different businesses, including knitting blankets, a DIY shop, selling fruits, a corner shop, selling chickens, and transport services.

This loan will benefit microenterprises in Amalia's group. Amalia herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" two years ago, following an invitation from one of the organisation's representatives, who went to visit her in her home. Amalia currently has a business selling foods. She tells us that the business was the family trade and, when she moved in with her partner, Amalia decided to start the same kind of business.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying vegetables in bulk from sellers in the city of El Alto; Amalia will then sell the vegetables at her stall. This work allows Amalia to earn an income to support her family; she has a partner and two children.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer", Amalia responds that she likes the loans offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for essential tractor repairs

loans.name: Sareim Long's Group

texts.en: Sareim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sareim makes a living cultivating rice  and her sons also do extra work as farm laborers to support her family. In their village there is no piped water or reliable well. Between them, the members in Sareim’s group have 3 young children who who are vulnerable to getting sick as a result of drinking dirty, contaminated water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water to their families

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters for resale

loans.name: Sophors Men's Group

texts.en: Sophors’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophors makes a living cultivating rice and she does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Thy Phon's Group

texts.en: Thy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thy makes a living cultivating rice with her family and doing extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no piped water or reliable well. Between them, the members in Thy’s group have 4 young children who are vulnerable to getting sick as a result of drinking dirty, contaminated water. Having a water filter at home will help each of member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses.

loans.use: To enable each member of the group to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water to their families

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sheep and lambs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Las Palmeras está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y así seguir creciendo.
Maria, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos sobre pedidos y también trabaja como niñera,  tiene una buena clientela formada, en su última encuesta se encontraba mucho mejor gracias a su trabajo, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada trabajando.
Pide este préstamo para comprar cosméticos variados para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y trabajando.
texts.en:
Las Palmeras is in its second loan cycle of the committee of women program. They are doing a poverty elimination survey in order to get to know each other's personal circumstances and as a result, continue growing. 

Maria, one of the members, makes a living selling cosmetics to order. She also works as a nanny. She has formed a good clientele. Her last survey showed that her situation is much better, thanks to her work, but at the same time she continues to work enthusiastically.  She is requesting this loan to buy various cosmetics to sell in order to be able to continue growing and working.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Maria, age 34, is a taro farmer. She owns a small plantation where she grows crops that she can then harvest and sell in her community or at the market. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She is unmarried and has one child.

Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2010. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, fertilizer, sprayers, and chemicals for her plantation.
  
Maria will use the profits from her sales to expand her business into other nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, fertilizer, sprayers, and chemicals

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro tiene 36 años de edad, vive en su casa de material rustico, en el distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de “aguardiente” una bebida producida a base de caña de azúcar tradicional de la sierra norte del Perú, Leandro ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para implementar sus equipos de destilación y con eso incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Leandro is 36 years old. He lives in his house made of rustic materials in the district of Callayuc.  The people of his town make a living in agriculture, commerce and ranching. Callayuc is located in the Cutervo province which is a part of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. 

He is a distiller of "aguardiente", a drink made from traditional sugarcane grown in the northern highlands of Peru. Leandro has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternative to install distillation equipment and, through this, increase his earnings.

loans.use: to install distillation equipment  and, through this, increase his earnings.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 31 years old and all of her children are attending school.

Rowena has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rowena has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, age 50, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past four years. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mercy and her husband have three children.  

She is currently requesting a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 37 years old and married with nine children. Eight of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ester has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.



Ester is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 30 years old and married. She has three children, who are all in school. Mylen works very hard to provide for them.

Mylen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Mylen would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, age 58, sells purified water to earn an income. She has been engaged in this retail business for the past 20 years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
 
She and her husband have five children.
 
Sylvia is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to replenish her inventory with a stock of purified water to offer for sale.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to replenish her inventory with a stock of purified water to offer for sale

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a forty-seven year old married male living in Kasese with four children and two dependents and all attend school. Alfred has been a a teacher for twenty-four years and works eight hours a day plus he does farming as additional income. Alfred wants a loan to pay school fees for his children and hopes to improve on his family's standards of living. Alfred likes his job; however, long distance and low salary payment are challenges he faces.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira, age 36, offers pre-paid mobile phone loading services to earn an income. She has been in her e-loading business for the past three years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She and her husband have three children.
 
Almira is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more pre-paid load time to offer for sale.

In the future, Almira would like to save enough money to build a restaurant at the local public market.

loans.use: to purchase pre-paid mobile phone load time to offer for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from oyster culture.  Imelda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is a 44-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Eden has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Eden has been in this business for six years. In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a 47 year old married lady with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in sewing school uniforms. She is facing challenges of defaulters. She has a vision of building a residential house. Jeniffer needs a loan to buy uniform materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy uniform materials to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 36 year old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in farming alongside earning a monthly salary. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning. His greatest challenge is unpredictable seasonal changes. Robert needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his own health problems.

loans.name: Patricia Estela

texts.es: Patricia es una mujer que se destaca pro buscar cualquier medio para obtener un recurso que le permita alimentar su familia, hace tres años se dedica a la venta de sandalias actividad a la que le da muchas gracias a dios y a sus clientes puesto que los resultados de estas ventas han sido muy satisfactorios y sus productos gustan, basándose en este éxito la señora patricia solicita un crédito para la compra de sandalias que le permitan seguir forjando su sueño de crecer como empresaria siempre buscando el beneficio de su familia y el agradecimiento a Dios.
texts.en: Patricia is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family.  Three years ago she began making a living selling sandals. She thanks God and her clients for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and her products well-liked.  Based on this success, Patricia is asking for a loan for the purchase of sandals which will allow her to continue to forge her dream of growing as an entrepreuneur, always looking for the well being of her family and the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy sandals, which will enable her to continue forging her dream of providing a better quality of life to her family .

loans.name: Rositas De Chipamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL DE VILAQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, artesanía, tejido de chompas, venta de tostados, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de ganado, venta de salchipapa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar que posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra la esposa del socio a su lado ella esta vestida con una chompa amarilla
texts.en:
The "Mariscal de Vilaque" communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana field office. It's made up of eight members and is led by an executive board of which Señora Basilia is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including food sales, artisanal crafts, knitting sweaters, tostada sales, vegetable sales, a neighborhood store, livestock sales, and sales of "salchipapa" [sausage with fried potatoes].

The loan they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses like Basilia's. She states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a representative of the institution who had come to visit her at home. Currently, she has a food sales business. She explains that her business was a family business that she decided to undertake independently after her marriage. 
 
The loan that she will now take out is for increasing her capital to buy groceries at wholesale. She will acquire them from vendors in the city of El Alto and after she cooks them, she will sell them in her sales location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has one son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans that the institution offers.

In the photograph, the member's spouse is at her side. She is wearing a yellow sweater.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 29-year-old, single woman with four children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. Ana has requested a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a machete, an axe, gloves and a sprayer.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. She hopes to use her profits for the betterment of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, a machete, an axe, gloves and a sprayer.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 56 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school.

Rafaela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rafaela has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 14 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Rafaela would like to expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Juditha is a lapida (stone marker) maker in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her business.

In the future, Juditha would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en: Rolyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Rolyn has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from laundry. Rolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anilen

texts.en: Anilen is 19 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Anilen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.  In the future, Anilen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Elvira is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nevaditas De Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE CORAPATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, artesanía, tejido de chompas, venta de tostados, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de ganado, venta de salchipapa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, ya que ella desde niña ayudaba en el tejido a sus padres, cuando se casó decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Nevaditas de Corapata" is starting the second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana.  It consists of eight partners and is run by a board of directors of which Juana is the president.  The businesses engaged in by the partners of the communal association are various, among them are: food sales, handicraft production, the weaving of sweaters, the sale of prepared foods, the sale of vegetables, a neighborhood shop, the sale of livestock, and the sale of kebabs.

The loan they will get will benefit the small microbusinesses in which Juana is a partner.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago.  She joined at the invitation of a promoter from the institution who went to visit her in her house.  These days she has a business weaving blankets which she states is a family business. She used to help her parents weave when she was a child.  When she married, she decided to start her own independent business.
 
The loan she will take out will be used to increase her capital (to buy wool wholesale) which she will acquire from the saleswomen in the city of El Alto and which she will market in her sales location after manufacture.  This kind of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family since she is married and has three children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Rosas De Mazo Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE MAZO CRUZ” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: lechería, tienda de barrio, ganadería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roxana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  comercio de lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente porque el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cebada por mayor) que adquirirá de los comunarios aledaños y posteriormente alimentará a su ganado con el mismo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rosas de Mazo Cruz" communal bank will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of eight members and led by an executive board of which Señora Roxana is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including a dairy, a neighborhood store, and livestock production.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses like Roxana's. She states that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, her business is the sale of dairy products. She explains that she learned this business previously because it was a family business; after having her first son, she decided to launch an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital for the purchase of barley at wholesale. She will acquire it from the neighboring communities and later feed it to her cattle. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single and has one son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the institution's health-related offerings.

loans.use: to buy barley at wholesale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 37 years old and married with four children. Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Grace has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and also earns an income from ready-to-wear clothing. Grace aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Pualele

texts.en:
Pualele is 59 years old and married, with ten children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pualele needs a loan to buy a tiller, a spade, a new wheelbarrow, and gloves. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. Pualele will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a tiller, a spade, a new wheelbarrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a 21-year-old, married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years.

Connie has requested a loan to buy weed killer chemicals, a machete, a wheelbarrow, new gloves, and a rake. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2009. With her profits, Connie hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy weed killer chemicals, a machete, a wheelbarrow, new gloves, and a rake.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER” iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, bisutería, lavado de arena, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  comercio de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente porque el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Amanecer" [Sunrise] communal bank will begin its twentieth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of eight members and led by an executive board of which Señora Ignacia is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including potato sales, jewelry sales, sand washing, blanket weaving, and food sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses like Ignacia's. She states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a potato sales business. She explains that she learned this business because it was a family business. After having her first child, she decided to launch an independent business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital for the purchase of potatoes at wholesale. She will acquire them in neighboring communities and then sell them in her sales location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is a widow and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale

loans.name: Tania Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 35  años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 8 años que estudian en universidad,  colegio y escuela.
Doña Tania es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para sacar adelante a  sus hijos, ella tiene un restaurante en las afueras de una empresa de la localidad, allí prepara desayunos y  almuerzos, sus ventas están aseguradas ya que todo el personal de esta empresa se sirve sus platos los mismos que son deliciciosos y al gusto de su clientela, ella siempre les cambia el menú para que ellos tengan opción a elegir día a día, trabaja con la ayuda de tres personas más a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual, así ella sale adelante y también estas personas que son de escasos que con este trabajo pueden llevar el pan a su hogar, ya son 15 años con este negocio el cual le encanta ya que la cocina es su vida.
Este  crédito es para comprar Víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella saca adelante a sus hijos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Familia con Suerte meet every two weeks in the neighborhood of Miraflores, in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year around. It is also famous for its outstanding beauty and many tourist attractions.

Tania lives in this place. She is 35 years old, and a single mother of four kids. The kids are 17, 15, 13 and 8 years old. They attend college, high school, and elementary school respectively.

Doña Tania likes to take care of herself and her children. She has a restaurant in a company located on the outskirts of town. She prepares breakfast and lunch there. Her sales are guaranteed because the company staff get their meals there. The meals are delicious and prepared according to her customers´ preferences. She always changes the menu, so they can have a different choice every day. She gets help from three other persons, she pays them a monthly salary. That’s the way she and these people get ahead. Thanks to this job, these people, who have limited resources, can provide for their homes. She is being running this business for 15 years. She loves it because cooking is her passion. 

She is going to use this loan to buy the provisions to prepare the food. She is being a member of the Grupo de Crédito since the beginning. She likes it because with these loans she can support her children. Her dreams are that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean his 800 cacao trees

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marivic has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new equipment for her abaca weaving.

Marivic has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 42-year-old married woman with nine children. 

Christina has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to buy a rake, new gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar and chemicals. 

Christina has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, she hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a rake, new gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar and chemicals

loans.name: Dalias De Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DALIAS DE ACHOCALLA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daisy es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de mantas, venta de chompas, artesano, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daisy es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al apoyar a su madre quien realizaba la venta del mismo producto, pasados los años decide emprenderlo independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en las comerciantes de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias no se encuentra, por razones de salud fue al consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The communal association "Dalias de Achocalla" will start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion.  It composed of eleven partners and is run by a board of directors of which Daisy is the secretary.  The businesses engaged in by the partners of the communal association are various among which are; making blankets, the sale of sweaters, handicrafts, transportation services, a neighborhood shop, and clothing sales.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the small microbusinesses in which Daisy is a partner.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago.  She joined at the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a member of the institution.  Nowadays she has a sales business from a sewing workshop.  She would like it to be known that this business was started with the support of her mother who used to sell the same product.  After some time, she decided to try to do it independently.

The loan she will take out now will be used to increase her capital (to buy cloth wholesale) which she will get from the merchants in the city of El Alto and afterward she will sell in her sales space.  This kind of work allows her to generate the resources to maintain her family since she lives with her parents.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training and health area that they offer to her in the institution.

In the picture, one of the partners is not to be found.  For health reasons, she went to the doctor's office.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frescos, tienda de barrio, venta de llauchas (empanadas tradicionales), servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar que este negocio era de gran venta en el mercado paceño, es por ello que decide emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, los ahorro , el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Sartasiñani" communal bank will begin its fifteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of eight members and led by an executive board; Señora Isabel is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including drink sales, a neighborhood store, sale of "llauchas" (traditional empanadas [savory stuffed pastries]), a transportation service, clothing sales, and cosmetics sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses like Isabel's. She states that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a food sales business; she explains that she learned this business when she observed that the business was a big seller in the La Paz market. That's why she decided to launch this business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital for the purchase of groceries at wholesale, which she will acquire in the street markets of the city of El Alto. After preparing them, she will sell them in her sales location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is a widow and has two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans, the savings, the health-related offerings, and the trainings that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Isamar Del Pilar

texts.es: Isamar a sus 21 años  de edad, imparte clases de educación primaria en zona rural a 10 kilómetros aproximadamente de su domicilio actual, los sábados estudia para terminar la carrera de Pedagogía.  Con su dificultad por ser asalariada del Estado no logra con su propio recursos comprar una Computadora, la que le es útil para sus investigaciones y trabajos, ella solicita financiamiento para poder realizar esta inversión y aprovecharla al máximo en sus tiempos libres.   Se propone una vez terminada su carrera formar un hogar y procrear hijos los cuales anhela tener.
texts.en: Isamar, who is 21, teaches primary school children in a rural area some 10 kilometres from where she currently lives. On Saturdays she studies so she can complete her teaching qualification. Being a state employee, she cannot afford to buy a computer which is useful to her for his reports and essays.  She is seeking funding to enable her to make this investment and to make maximum use of it during her free time. Once she has completed her course, she plans to get married and have the children she dreams of.

loans.use: Compra de Computadora para Estudiar

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and a married mother with nine children. Four of her children currently attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arlene has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more equipment to use in her abaca weaving.

Arlene has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to be use for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 50 years old and a married mother with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alejandra has an internet café business in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional computer supplies for her internet café.

Alejandra has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alejandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 53-year-old married mother of nine children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Cresencia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

Cresencia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Geraldina

texts.es:
Al acercarse a la casa hecha de maderas y zinc de Geraldina de 21 años, se escucha el sonido sincronizado y musical de las manos de alguien sobre algo parecido a un tambor. Al entrar se encuentra a esta madre soltera con cuatro hijos a cargo, todos menores de 5 años, dando repetidas palmadas sobre una pequeña pelota de masa colocada sobre un plástico transparente en forma de circulo para obtener la forma natural de  las tortillas. Geraldina lleva haciendo y vendiendo tortillas desde hace 8 años, cuando su madre la apoyó para seguir con la tradición que inició su abuela, la cual también incluye hacer y vender nacatamales los fines de semanas.
Geraldina dejó el colegio  terminando el segundo año de la secundaria, pues necesitaba ayudar a su madre y abuela con el negocio. Ahora es un negocio familiar donde también contribuye su hermana, comercializando el producto en su casa y de ambulante en lugares cercanos. Debido a que no tienen otros ingresos, necesita de un préstamo para comprar masa, plástico, carbón y otros productos al por mayor para obtenerlos a menor precio. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción, extender su negocio a un lugar con mayor afluencia de clientes y seguir creciendo para ahorrar y mejorar su casa, como siempre lo han soñado.
texts.en:
Upon approaching 21 year old Geraldina’s house, which is made from wood and zinc, you hear the synchronized sound of the musical hands of someone on something like a drum.  Upon entering you find this single mother with four children under her care.  All of them are less than five years old.  She repeatedly pats a small ball of dough that is located on a circular piece of transparent plastic in order to get the natural shape of the tortillas.

Geraldina has been making and selling tortillas for eight years.  That is when her mother helped her to continue with the tradition that her grandmother started.  This also includes making and selling ‘nacatamales’ [stuffed tortillas] on the week-ends.

Geraldina left school after completing her second year of high school.  She needed to help her mother and her grandmother with the business.  It is now a family business where her sister also contributes by selling the product at her house and in an itinerant manner in nearby places.

Because they do not have other income, they need a loan to buy dough, plastic, charcoal, and other products wholesale in order to get a better price.  This will allow her to increase her production, to extend her business to a place with a greater flow of customers, and to continue growing.  She will do this in order to save and to improve her house as they have always dreamed of doing.

loans.use: to buy dough, plastic, charcoal, and other products

loans.name: Las Amapolas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Amapolas forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza y también del programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya, están en su sexto ciclo, y demuestran que tienen muchas ganas de poder crecer, superarse y salir adelante.
Violeta es una miembro ejemplo, ella se dedica a la venta de edredones y también de sabanas, que vende de manera ambulante.  Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que está demostrando sus ganas de superarse y de salir adelante, todo esto para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar edredones y sabanas, de manera a tener una mayor variedad que dar a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus otras compañeras están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Las Amapolas Group is part of the program to eradicate poverty and also of the program of the Paraguayan foundation's women committee. They are in their sixth loan cycle, and show that they want to grow, get better and move forward. Violeta is a role model member. She works selling duvets and also bedsheets, which she sells in an itinerant way. She is a hardworking person, who has demonstrated her desire to improve and move forward in order to help her family. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy duvets and bedsheets so that she can have a greater variety to offer her customers. She is grateful for the chance that she and her other partners are receiving to be able to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: To buy duvets and bedsheets for sale.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is 65 years old and married with six children. She has a small store selling a variety of items. She has requested a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks and cigarettes. 

Vi will use her profits to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks and cigarettes

loans.name: Faalanumaaveave

texts.en:
Faalanumaaveave is a 29-year-old unwed woman with two children. She has a small business selling elei printed material in her community. 

Faalanumaaveave needs a loan to purchase fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, material, rollers and brushes. She hopes to save her profits in case of an emergency. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, material, rollers and brushes

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Rosa es la presidenta de este grupo, quien comenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a luchar por capacitarse e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus respectivas familias. Ella se dedica a las ventas, trabaja en el mercado todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde.
Pide de este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para la venta, que le permitirá seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar su microemprendiemiento, ya que por medio de esto ayuda a su familia.
texts.en: This group is called Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) and is in the sixth cycle of the Women's Committee's program. The group is also part of the program's poverty reduction initiative, which allows them to learn the living situation of each member and work accordingly. Rosa is group president and says she has always tried to motivate the membership to fight for skills training and an improved quality of life for their respective families. Her job is in sales, and she works at a market every day starting very early in the morning and going until very late. She's requesting this loan to buy various garments to sell, which would enable her to keep growing and striving to improve her micro-enterprise that she has used to help her family.

loans.use: Comprar prendas varias para la venta.

loans.name: Patricio Group

texts.es:
Patricio se llama este grupo, está en su ciclo número de 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, que es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles, como ser hamburguesas y minutas en general, esta actividad lo hace en su casa y también por las zonas aledañas de la ciudad. Ella comenta que también su marido trabaja por tanto de esa forma se ayudan.
Gladys pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, panificados, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
"Patricio" is the name of this group. It is in the sixth lending cycle of the women's committee program, where every single member is putting her best effort into being able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

One of the members is Señora Gladys, who is the president of the group. She earns her living making and selling food, such as hamburgers and other quick meals. She does this work in her house and also in neighboring areas of the city. She states that her husband also works, so they help each other.

Gladys is requesting this loan to be able to buy ingredients to keep making her foods, like vegetables, condiments, baked goods, and more. This way she will be able to continue selling her foods and striving to improve her living conditions. All the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, baked goods, and more

loans.name: Trigal 2 Group

texts.es:
Trigal 2 se llama este grupo, es bastante numeroso, donde todas ellas están trabajando para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Además de todo están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yessica, quien es vendedora de calzados varios, y por medio de este trabajo es que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella quiere tener algún día una tienda donde pueda vender todo tipo de productos y de esa forma ir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia. 
Yessica pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar zapatillas, sandalias, botas y demás calzados, para poder surtir su negocio y así seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Trigal 2 is the name of this group. It is a pretty large group, and all of its members are working in order to get ahead and help their families. They are also completing the poverty elimination survey, in order to learn about each member's situation.

Yessica is one of the members of this group. She sells different kinds of shoes, and her work allows her to have the means to be able to support her family. She wants to have a store some day where she could sell all sorts of products. That way she would be able to gradually grow and improve her and her family's life.

Yessica is requesting this loan because she wants to buy sneakers, sandals, boots, and other shoes, so that she can stock her business and continue offering good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sneakers, sandals, boots, and other shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, ha tenido un incremento en las ventas, ya que con el préstamo anterior tuvo la facilidad para surtir el inventario de la tienda con nuevos productos que son del gusto de sus clientes. Sus nuevos ingresos le ayudan a ofrecer a su familia un ambiente más confortable.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar boquitas, jugos, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, dulces, jabón, aceite, sal y verduras, le ayudara a mantener su negocio bien surtido y continuar contando con clientes satisfechos.
texts.en: Carlos has had an increase in sales. The previous loan facilitated the stocking of inventory of the store with new products that his customers like. His new income helps him offer his family a more comfortable environment. He is asking for a new loan to buy snacks, juice, rice, sodas, candies, soap, oil, salt, and vegetables. This will help him keep his business stocked and continue  to have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juices, rice, sugar, sodas, candies, soap, oil, salt and vegetables.

loans.name: Zaheyyeh

texts.en:
Zaheyyeh is a 35-year-old married woman from Gaza City. She lives with her husband and three kids (two sons and one daughter) in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he receives a low income. Currently, this is the only source of income for the family. 

Zaheyyeh is a student in a local university where she studies elementary education. Zaheyyeh would like to complete a BA degree and find a job in the future so she can help improve the family's living conditions. 

Zaheyyeh took a Murabaha loan in USD from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Zaheyyeh will be able to do her homework and write reports.

Zaheyyeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Maddah

texts.en:
Maddah is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his mother and brothers in a small house. His mother works as an employee in the public sector, for which she receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Maddah is a student in a local university where he studies technology management. Maddah would like to complete his BA degree and find a job in the future so he can help his family. 

Maddah took a Murabaha loan in USD from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Maddah will be able to do his homework and write reports using special programs.

Maddah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dough machine for his bakery.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Él trabaja como operario en una empresa cercana a su localidad y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposa quien tiene una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia mantienen la economía del hogar. José desea mejorar el techo y el piso de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar esta crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, polines, pernos, cemento, arena y grava para proceder a reparar el techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: José is 58, and lives in his own home with his wife. He works as an operator at a business near his town and, in this way, supports his home.  He and his wife also have a small shop in their home, with which they sustain the household economy.  José wishes to improve his home’s roof and floor and, for this reason, he has decided to request a loan FUSAI.  He will invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood, posts, hinges, cement, sand, and gravel to proceed with repairing the home’s roof and cementing the floor.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, posts, hinges, cement, sand, and gravel to  repair the home’s roof and cement the floor.

loans.name: Faamoa

texts.en:
Faamoa is a 71-year-old widow with 10 children. She runs a small elei printing business in her community. 

Faamoa needs a loan to purchase new stencils, a cutter, fabric paint, material, rollers and wooden carved designs. She hopes to use her profits pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to purchase new stencils, a cutter, fabric paint, material, rollers and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Kollamarka Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KOLLAMARCA” iniciará el cuadragésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, confección de usos, salón de belleza, venta de abarrotes, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es integrante, ella indica que hace treinta y cinco año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces y frescos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al ver a una amiga que comercializaba estos productos y obtener  un capital en Pro Mujer para implementar su negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de las de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo a la elaboración comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es viuda y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "Kollamarca" communal bank will begin its fortieth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is made up of nine members and led by an executive board; Señora Maxima is the treasurer. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including making braided blankets, food sales, cosmetics sales, sweets sales, a beauty salon, grocery sales, and a transportation service.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusiness owners like Maxima. She states that she joined Pro Mujer thirty-five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling sweets and drinks. She explains that she started this business after seeing a friend who sold these products and obtaining capital from Pro Mujer to establish her own independent business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital for the purchase of sugar at wholesale; she will acquire it at street markets in the city of El Alto and after preparing it, she will sell it in her sales location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is a widow and has seven children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the institution's heath-related offerings.

loans.use: to buy sugar at wholesale

loans.name: Saitapaa

texts.en:
Saitapaa is 30 years old and married, with three children. She has a small business, selling chicken and meat pies in her community. 

Saitapaa needs a loan to purchase onions, a bag of flour, soy sauce, meat, chicken breasts, and a large pot. 

With her profits, Saitapaa hopes to help pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase onions, a bag of flour, soy sauce, meat, chicken breasts, and a large pot.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is a 41-year-old unwed woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. 

Nive needs a loan to buy more crops, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. 

She will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more crops, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and new boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for her home appliance store to resell

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 18-year-old single young man from the city of Nablus. He lives with his parents in a very simple house. His father is an employee in a private firm where he earns a low income. This has been the only source of income to the family. Omar decided to help his family and improve their living conditions. For this reason, he started his own business selling candy for kids in his neighborhood. 

Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan helped him to start his candy sales business. By taking this loan and starting his business, Omar is able to help the family with part of their expenses. 

Omar appears in the photo, which was taken while he was at work.

loans.use: to start his business selling candy.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 19-year-old single young man from Gaza City. His mother works as an employee in a local firm where she earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Sami is a student in a local university where he studies business administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future to improve the family living conditions. 

He took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to do his homework and easily prepare his reports.
 
Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Taelotuma

texts.en:
Taelotuma is a 61-year-old widow with five children. She runs a small tailoring business. 

Taelotuma needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, scissors, material, thread, needles and a measuring tape. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, scissors, material, thread, needles and a measuring tape

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family land.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 42-year-old married mother of four who has been making and selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living for two years now. Having joined SPBD this year, Theresa is requesting a loan to buy bags of sugar, plastic cups, cordials and a large cooler. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, plastic cups, cordials and a large cooler

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 22-year old unwed woman with two children. 

She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Luisa needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, plastic cups, cordials, a large cooler, and Chinese candy. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Luisa has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, plastic cups, cordials, a large cooler, and Chinese candy

loans.name: Shawkat Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shawkat Al-Hodeidah. It consists of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Asmahan is the leader of the group. She is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a humble house in Hodeidah. She is an uneducated woman, but she is a very active and dynamic woman. Asmahan decided to improve the condition of her family. For this reason, she has started her own business selling ready-made children's clothes door-to-door. She found this business to be good for her. She has been in this business for two months. She earns good profits from this business, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family, so she wants to improve her business. To do so, Asmahan asked a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to purchase more ready-made children's clothes to resell to her customers in her area. 

Asmahan looks forward to expanding her business further by opening a small shop for selling all kinds of children's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made children's clothes to resell to her customers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a business direct selling Avon and Personal Collection products in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for three years now.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell

loans.name: Al- Sadikat Al- Omer Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Sadikat Al- Omer. It consists of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Hayat is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area of Hodeidah. She studied through elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She is a very active and dynamic woman. 

Hayat decided to improve the conditions of her family. She has started her own business selling ready-made women's clothes door-to-door. She found this business to be profitable for her. She has been in this business for four years. She earns good profits from this business. 

To further expand the business, Hayat asked for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes. 

Hayat looks forward to expanding her business through the purchase of all kinds of women's clothes, accessories, makeup, and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes

loans.name: Rania 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rania 4. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Fathia is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old and a married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old. All of the children are school-going.

In 2010, Fathia established her sambusa, a traditional food, business. She began her business because her husband immigrated to Saudi Arabia, and she assumed all the responsibility of the family. She started this business with a small amount of money. She is a very active and dynamic woman. She works seven days a week and fifteen hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB. She requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other materials in order to make sambusa and sell them to her customers.

In the future, Fathia hopes to build a shop. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living. She is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other materials in order to make and sell sambusa.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is single and has a direct-selling business. She sells Natasha, Avon and personal products in the Philippines.

Jennifer requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell to her customers.

Jennifer has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has a live-in partner woman with six children. Mary Jane is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mary Jane has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Matea has been in this business for 10 years now.

Matea requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Matea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 45 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has a sewing business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles and zippers for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 6 years. Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, needles and zippers for her business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 28 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Jenny is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenny has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jenny would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and mobile recharges to resell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de arroz de una variedad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y que pueda tener una buena cosecha, y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexander is 33 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and their children, who are his first priority. With his loan, he will purchase a variety of rice seeds that adapt well to conditions in his area so that he can have a good harvest. He will also purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to the crops so that he will have a good germination and quality seeds. He will also pay laborers to apply the products and assist on the plantation once he has it developed. This way, he will ensure that he does a good job.

What he hopes is that he can take advantage of the good weather conditions and ground that the area has for this crop. He would also like to put his years of experience with this crop into practice. In addition, he hopes to be able to purchase the best products so that his plantation will have good development and health, as well as a good harvest, and he hopes that he will have an important production in a short amount of time.

With the income that he hopes to receive from the harvest, he hopes to use it for the well-being and education of his family, achieve some family goals, and continue investing in his crops.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans in other banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with simplicity and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant rice.

loans.name: Zenna

texts.en:
Zenna has a live-in partner woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenna is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Zenna has a house rental business in the Philippines. Zenna requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business.

Zenna has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Zenna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth has a live-in partner and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.
