Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years now.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and one small kid in a simple house. For the past year, Mohammad has been working in a bakery store he owns. He makes different types of sweets. It is a good business and the demand is high. 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make new decorations and apply more shelves in his store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his bakery store and make it more attractive. Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to make new decorations and apply more shelves in his store.

loans.name: Flor Pensamiento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR PENSAMIENTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de estuco, venta de centros de faldas, venta de verduras, servicio de construcción, venta de carne de cordero, tienda de barrio, curandera naturista.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de estuco; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, cuando ella trabajaba como operaria en una estuquera, pasado el tiempo y con un poco capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de estuco por mayor) que adquirirá en las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "Flor Pensamiento" community group is beginning their third loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela focal center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Bertha is the president.The businesses that the members run are varied and include stucco sales, skirt sales, vegetable sales, construction services, lamb meat sales, markets, and natural healing.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small businesses of which Bertha is a member. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling stucco. She started this business many years ago, when she worked in a stucco business. Some time passed and she decided to open her business independently with a small amount of capital.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital (purchase stucco in bulk). She will purchase the stucco in communities in La Paz and will later sell it in her store. This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family, since she is married with one son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan and the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase stucco in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years now.

Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de mejorar en las condiciones del suelo y así mantener la fertilidad de los mismos durante más tiempo y para la asistencia del café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de una variedad más adecuada para las condiciones del suelo y hacer la resiembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 43 years old, married and lives with his wife and children who are his top priority. With this loan he aims to buy fertilizers, fungicides and pay labor costs to improve soil conditions. This is to maintain long term soil fertility and for the care of the coffee. Additionally he will buy some seedlings of a variety more suitable for the soil conditions and to reseed at the onset of the rainy season.

The objective is to increase the area's plant density and to also take advantage of the good soil fertility, weather and other conditions which favor coffee cultivation. With these improvements in cultivation he hopes to make a small profit, thereby improving his family's living conditions. He also wants to invest a little more in the area under cultivation and to achieve some goals. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had loans from state owned banks but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to renovate her house.

loans.name: Glenda Verónica

texts.es:
Glenda es una joven trabajadora de 26 años de edad, que  estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un hijo pues su pareja la abandonó y no le ayuda económicamente con el niño, en su vivienda solo vive junto a su hijo y es  la única persona que depende de ella.

Verónica  se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y cuidar de su hijo, pero ella también tiene su propio negocio, es un salón de belleza de donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos para ella y su bebé, comenta que ya tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad de estilista que lo aprendió en una escuela de cosmetología, ella hace todo tipo de peinados, cortes de cabello, tintes, etc. El salón lo tiene en su casa y por lo tanto no tiene que movilizarse hacia otro lugar para trabajar, la jornada de trabajo lo empieza temprano a las 7 de la mañana y la termina a las 7 de la noche.

El financiamiento del préstamo ella lo utilizará para cancelar unas deudas que tiene y también para comprar una máquina de cortar cabello equipada para que se le haga más fácil el trabajo  y con la ayuda del financiamiento le permitirá tener más variedad y estilos de costes  para sus clientes y ofrecerles un mejor servicio. Gracias al préstamo le generara mayores ingresos económicos para ella y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su hijo. 


Para el futuro Verónica  desea principalmente ampliar más su salón de belleza poder emplear a más personas y también tener una academia donde se impartan clases de cosmetología. También siempre ha deseado seguir estudiando y terminar su carrera universitaria y que su hijo crezca sano  y fuerte y que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Glenda is a hard working young woman, 26 years old, who finished high school.    She is a single mother to her son, because her partner abandoned her and doesn't help with the child.  She lives in her home with just her son, the only person who depends on her.

Veronica works at domestic tasks in the home and takes care of her child, but she also has her own business.  Her business is a beauty salon from which she gets an income for herself and her baby.  She comments that she has been working as a hair stylist for 10 years, work that she learned to do in cosmetology school.  She does all kinds of hairstyles, cuts, dyes, etc.    She maintains the salon in her house and  thus does not have to travel to another place to work.  The day's work begins early, at 7 in the morning, and ends at 7 at night.

She will use the money from the loan to pay off some debts and also to buy a hair-cutting machine to make her work easier.  With this financial help she can offer more variety in haircut styles for her clients and better service.   Thanks to the loan she will generate more income and she and her son will have a better quality of life.

In the future Veronica mainly wants to enlarge her beauty salon, employ more people, and also have an academy with classes in cosmetology.  She has also always wanted to continue studying and finish her university degree, and wants her son to grow strong and well and be a good person.

loans.use: to pay some debts and also to buy a hair-cutting machine

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a 20-year-old unwed woman with one child. She runs a store selling a variety of items in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Sally has requested a loan to purchase a chest freezer, frozen goods and a hanging scale. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to purchase a chest freezer, frozen goods and a hanging scale

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 20 years old and single with no children. She runs a small elei printing business to earn a living in her community. She has been doing this for four years. Linda needs a loan to buy brushes, stencils, fabric paint, wooden carved designs and material. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy brushes, stencils, fabric paint, wooden carved designs and material.

loans.name: Vicuñitas 5K Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS 5K” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elvira es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño y papa, tejido de mantas y chompas, venta de plásticos, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, hilado de lana de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elvira es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una sobrina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, cuando ella cultivaba este producto, posteriormente con un capital más amplio decide comprar el producto y comercializarlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá en las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "VICUÑITAS 5K" community group will begin its third loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela focal center. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Elvira is the treasurer. The members run various businesses, including: dried and fresh potato sales, blanket and jacket weaving, plastic sales, neighborhood store, vegetable sales, and spinning vicuña wool.  

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses like Elvira's. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a niece, who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling potato and chuño (dried potatoes). She started this business many years ago when she grew this product. Later, with more capital, she decided to purchase the product and sell it.
 
The loan that she is taking out is to increase capital (purchase potatoes in bulk). She will purchase the potatoes in communities in La Paz and later sell them in her store. This job allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Kollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KOLLITAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Giovana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos y joyas, ayudante de tornería, artesanía en yeso, venta de juguetes, venta de perfumes por catálogos, compra y venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Giovana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio conjuntamente su primer negocio de tienda de barrio, con el pasar del tiempo decide dedicarse a la venta de ropa, ya que le da mejores ganancias.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución

En la imagen se identifica que una socia no esta presente, la razon es que se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The "Kollitas" community group is on its eighth loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela focal center. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Giovana is the secretary. The members have various businesses, including: neighborhood store, jewelry and cosmetic sales, mechanic's assistant, plaster artisan, toy sales, perfume sales by catalog, and purchase and sale of detergent.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses like Giovana's. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago when a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a clothing sales business. She tells us that she began this business along with her first business, a neighborhood store, and decided to dedicate herself to clothing sales after a while since it provided better income. 
 
The loan that she is taking out is to increase capital (purchase clothing in bulk). She will purchase the clothing at the markets in the city of La Paz and later sell them on foot (without a set location) in the markets in the city of El Alto. This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health focus that the institution offers.

The member is not present in the photograph because she was at a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, tejido de mantas, venta de escobas, consultorio dental, venta de material cristiano, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió mediante una amiga hace varios años, observado pudo asimilar la técnica de tejido posteriormente decidió emprender un negocio con esta técnica nueva.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las comerciantes de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución y su grupo.

Se identifica una socia que no esta presente porque se encuentra en el consultorio médico
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Dios" is starting its 2nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Collpani central office.  This group has 9 members, and is led by a board of directors where Teodora is the president.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: coca leaf sales, blanket-weaving, broom sales, a dental office, sales of Christian religious items, and cosmetic sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesswomen in Teodora's group.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago at the invitation of a loan officer who went to visit her at her house.  Now she has a business weaving blankets.  She got to know this business because a friend taught it to her a number of years ago.  She was able to learn the technique of weaving, and later she decided to start up a business with this new skill.

Teodora will use this loan to increase her capital (to buy wool at wholesale).  She will buy from the traders in the city of La Paz, and later she will make the blankets and sell them from her retail space.  By working this way, she can generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has 8 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings accounts offered by the institution and her group.

Note: one of the members of this group does not appear in the photo because they had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale

loans.name: Dúo Rositas Group

texts.es: Dúo Rositas este grupo esta conformado por la señora Alejandra de 38 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, en esta oportunidad está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir su tienda, ya que le falta un poco mas para agrandar mas su negocio. esperando que le puedan ayudar para seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en: The communal bank "Duo Rositas" includes Alejandra, who is 38 years old.  She has a business selling food products.  She has been in this line of work for 10 years.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store, because she needs more products so that she can expand her business.  Alejandra is hoping that you can help her to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Myrachel

texts.en:
Myrachel is 24 years old, married and has one child who is currently in school.

Myrachel is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Myrachel requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

Myrachel has been raising cattle for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Myrachel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel is 38 years old and single.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. She has been in this line of work for five years, and has taken out and repaid four prior loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. Sabina has been in her current line of work for four years, and has taken out and repaid fourteen prior loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zandra

texts.en: Zandra is 44 years old, married and the mother of one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 40,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as snack foods, rice, detergent, bath soap, shampoo, cereals, eggs and noodles. She has been in this line of work for 24 years and sells a variety of items to her customers. Her goal for the future is to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 35 years old and married with three children. Two children are currently in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, farming coconut in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arlene has farmed coconut for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 26-year-old single man from a small village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a simple house. For the past  few years, Abed has worked in a cafe where he serves soft drinks and rents billiard tables. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Abed's loan will help him to redecorate his cafe and repair the billiard tables. He will be able to improve his business and make it more attractive.

loans.use: to redecorate his cafe and repair the billiard tables.

loans.name: Salauta

texts.en:
Salauta is a 44-year-old divorced woman with one child. She wants to start a small business, making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour and sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil and a new oven.

 In the future, Salauta hopes to save money for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil and a new oven.

loans.name: Las Viajeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VIAJERAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de frutas, costura de deportivos, servicio de transporte, venta de frescos, venta de artefactos de auto.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  comercio de víveres; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente cuando enamoró con su esposo, cuando se casó decide establecer un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en los Departamentos de Beni y Pando. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es concubina  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Las Viajeras communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Valeria is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are selling vegetables, selling fruit, making sportswear, transportation service, selling soft drinks, and selling items for cars.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where Valeria is a member.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business of selling food.  She says that she learned this business because when she fell in love with her husband and when she got married she decided to establish an independent business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy food wholesale).  She will get the food from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell it in the Beni and Pando departments.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy food wholesale.

loans.name: San Sebastian B Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN SEBASTIAN B” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por catorce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, ferretería, tienda de barrio, venta de slachipapas, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de tenis, artesana, venta de comida, venta de chuño, servicio de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio conjuntamente hace dos años atrás al tener la oportunidad de viajar y conocer la dinámica de venta de estos productos decide emprender su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de golosinas por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "San Sebastian B" community group will begin its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela focal center. It is made up of 14 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Maria is the president. The members run various businesses, including a bookstore, a hardware store, a neighborhood store, salchipapa sales, blanket sales, clothing sales, snack sales, sneaker sales, artisan crafts, food sales, dried potato sales, and a coffee shop.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses like Cecilia's. She tells us that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer and that she joined because a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling snacks. She started this business two years ago. After she had the opportunity to travel and get to know the dynamic of the sales of these products, she decided to open her own business.
 
The loan that she is requesting is to increase capital (purchase snacks in bulk). She will purchase the snacks in the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell them at her store. This job allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase snacks in bulk.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 48 years old, married and the mother of eleven children, five of whom are still enrolled in school. She works very hard running her general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. She has been in her current line of work for 10 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Vaisaulu

texts.en:
Vaisaulu is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. 

She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, spring onions, tomatoes, and green peppers to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

Vaisaulu has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, a new water hose, and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Vaisaulu hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, a new water hose, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario vive en la ciudad de chincha, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho entusiasmo trabaja como empleada en una empresa de su ciudad, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos y sobre todo sacar adelante a su hijo de 2 años de edad.

Rosario esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en el terreno que su npadre le ha brindado ya que empezara la contrucción de su vivienda, de esta manera podrá ir aconicionando el terreno para la construcción de su vivienda y de esta manera seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en: Rosario lives in the city of Chincha. She is a young woman with much desire to improve, so she works with a lot of enthusiasm for a company in the city. This allows her the income to pay the household expenses and bring up her 2 year old son. Rosario is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can make improvements to the land that her father has given to her so she can start construction of her house. In this way she can prepare the land for the building of her home and continue to strive for her great dream which is to have her own house and be able to provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: to make improvements to her land to begin construction.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is a 62-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. 

Ramona needs a loan to buy a crowbar, wheelbarrow, machete, gloves and  boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Ramona will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a crowbar, wheelbarrow, machete, gloves and boots to use on her plantation.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising pigs. Elena is borrowing 10,000  PHP to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities with her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 41 years old and single.  She runs a general store in the Philippines. Emelia has requested a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries such as canned goods, bread, coffee, sugar, snack foods, and cooking oil to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as canned goods, bread, coffee, sugar, snack foods, and cooking oil to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Estelita earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 47 years old and has eight children. She is married and has six children who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business and farms sugarcane and rice in the Philippines. Eufemia has been farming sugarcane and rice for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Eufemia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 60 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. Brigida requested a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase items such as snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, and seasoning to sell in her store.

She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming sugar cane. Brigida has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF.

Brigida aspires to build and expand her business to help secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snack food, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, and seasonings to sell in her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for 40 years now.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials like a fishing net and lamp for her business.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a fishing net and lamp for her business

loans.name: Amine

texts.en:
Amine, a native of Morocco, moved to the States seven years ago. A consummate businessman, Amine studied his Boston surroundings, pinpointed a demand for limo services and committed himself to providing high-quality transportation services. He founded Deluxe Imports Exports LLC a year-and-a-half ago, and currently has one employee. 

Amine has struggled to come up with working capital to maintain business operations, and had difficulty accessing credit; with this loan, he will be able to cover his overhead costs. Help Amine build his limousine fleet to five vehicles, and eventually earn his MBA!

loans.use: to have working capital to maintain his business operations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital to be able to fulfill more contracts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, prepare the land to plant crops of corn and beans, buy fertilizers and compost for the crops, and pay for labor

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto  grado, debido a su situación económica no pudo continuar con sus estudios y tuvo que trabajar para aportar en los gastos económicos de su hogar, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja es policía, tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 17 y 15 años, ambos estudian, ella se dedica a vender pupusas y  recibe ayuda de sus hijos en los tiempos libres, y de su esposo cuando tiene vacaciones.

María tiene 10 años de dedicarse a vender pupusas comenta que comenzó con un local pequeño y con el tiempo vio que le funcionaba y decidió aumentar las ventas, tiene diez años de dedicarse a este trabajo y comenta que le funciona bien, la iniciativa de poner este local la tuvo por su madre que siempre le apoyaba en sus decisiones y también por ala necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El crédito lo utilizará para invertirlo siempre en la pupusería, pero ella lo que quiere hacer es poner otro local,  específicamente comprará una cocina para hacer pupusas, y los ingredientes para la elaboración de las mismas.

María siempre ha querido expandir más sus negocio, poner más locales que le generen mayores ingresos y también desea mejorar un poco la vivienda para vivir más cómodamente con su familia, para sus hijos desea lo mejor que sigan estudiando mucho para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and studied until grade 5. She could not continue her studies due to her economic situation and had to work to help with the expenses of the household. She is married, her husband is a policeman. She has two children aged 15 and 17, both of whom study. She sells pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean food) and she gets help from her children in their free time and her husband when he is on vacation.

María has been selling pupusas for 10 years and comments that she started out with a very small location. With time she saw that it was functioning and she decide to increase her sales. When she started it was her mother that got her to get the stand and she always supported her in her decisions and supported her in bringing her children up.

María will use the loan to invest once more in the business. What she wants to do is open another sales location, specifically buy a stove to cook the pupusas and the ingredients to make them. María has always wanted to expand her business more, opening more locations which will generate more revenues. She also wants to make improvements on her house so she and her family can live in more comfort. As for her children she wants the best and that they continue to study and become useful members of society.

loans.use: to invest in her pupusa business, buying  a stove and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 39 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Flordeliza has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flordeliza is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dúo Sol Y Sombra Group

texts.es: Dúo Sol Y Sombra es dúo esta conformado por la señora Maria Jesus de 38 años de edad,ella tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta, ya que el sueño de ella es tener un negocio mas grande  para ayudar a su familia y salir adelante
texts.en: The "Sun and "Shadow" duo was formed by Señora Maria Jesus, who is 38 years old. She has a store where she sells food products. She has had this business for four years. At this time, she is applying for this loan to purchase food products to sell. Her dream is to have a bigger business in order to help her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Этого молодого студента зовут Сухроб. Он из города Худжанд - северной столицы Таджикистана. Сухроб холост. Ему скоро исполнится 19 лет. Он в данный момент и учится и работает. Сухроб учится на экономиста во втором курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета. Он прилежный студент и старается не пропускать занятия. Сухроб особенно любит учить математику и экономику. После учебы он еще и подрабатываает оператором, так как не хочет быть обузой для родителей.  
Сухроб сейчас не в финансовом состоянии, чтобы оплатить за свою учебу. Поэтому он берет кредит. Из запрашиваемой суммы Сухроб около 90 долларов потратит на учебные принадлежности, а остальная часть суммы полностью пойдет на оплату годового контракта. Сухроб очень надеется, что ему окажут финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Meet Suhrob, a young student from Khujand, the capital city of northern Tajikistan.  Suhrob is single and almost 19 years old.  He is currently studying and working.  Suhrob is a second-year student at Khujand State University, where he studies economics.  He is an assiduous student  who tries not to miss any classes.  He particularly enjoys studying mathematics and economics.  When he is not studying, Suhrob works as a mechanic, as he doesn't want to be a burden for his parents.

Suhrob is currently not in a position to pay for his studies.  This is the reason why he is taking a loan.  Out of the amount requested, he will use $90 for the purchase of school supplies and will use the rest of the money to pay his total annual tuition fees.  He is hoping to receive financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his annual university tuition fees and to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Enrique

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 52 años de edad, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en ocasiones se involucra en las actividades de la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 trabajan con él.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos 35 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres y tíos pues antes trabajaban en asocios como familia, en la actualidad no existe otra fuente de ingresos solo la de jornalero y agricultor, su trabajo le queda a unos veinte minutos de su casa viaja todos los días y lo hace a pie, trabaja cinco horas diarias pues por la tarde asiste a una iglesia evangélica.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar los fertilizantes que necesitará para lo producción de maíz y frijol porque eso es lo que don Pedro siembra, la zona es muy buena para producir frijol, por lo que si logra sembrar estará asegurando la alimentación de su familia para un año más y asegura que se sentirá satisfecho.

Su sueño es que su hija culmine los estudios por lo menos una carrera técnica para que pueda a conseguir un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro is 52 years old and married.  His wife is a housewife and sometimes works in farming.  They have five children but only two work with him.

Pedro has been a farmer for 35 years and learned this from his father and uncles because they used to work together as a family.  He has no other source of income other than being a farmer and worker.  His job site is 20 minutes from his home and he goes there every day on foot and works about five hours a day and attends church in the evenings.

He needs this loan to buy the fertilizers he needs for his corn and bean production because this is what Pedro raises.  This area is good for bean production and what he grows will ensure that he can feed his family for another year.  He will be satisfied with that.

He wants his daughter to finish school and have a technical career and be able to get a dignified job.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Arístides

texts.es: Arístides es una persona de 38 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 6 hijos: 4 hombres y 2 mujeres, obtiene sus ingresos en trabajos de albañilería, a veces trabaja dentro del municipio y otra veces sale a otros departamentos, Arístides solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 6,500.00 para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción (block, cemento y hierro). Lo que más anhela Arístides es terminar de construir sus cuartos que hace un buen tiempo empezó.
texts.en: Arístides is 38 years old and lives with his family in Sololá, within the Sololá department.  He has six children; 4 sons and 2 daughters.  He earns her income working as a mason and sometimes works in the city and other times in other areas.  Arístides is asking for this loan in the amount of Q. 6,500.00 to buy building materials (cinder block, cement, and iron bars).  What Arístides would really like is to finish building the rooms he began some time ago.

loans.use: to build some rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Chubaka Group

texts.fr: Madame Ntigura est présidente de l’association de crédit Chubaka. Mariée à un chômeur, elle est  mère  de 12 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle effectue des activités de commerce depuis 1980. Agée de 55ans, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 5 casiers de boissons sucrées et alcoolisées. Elle projette agrandir son entreprise et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Au final, elle rend grâce à Dieu et bénie Hekima de soutenir les femmes  à bas revenu.
texts.en: Mrs. Ntigura is the chair of the Chubaka borrowers' association. Her husband is unemployed. She has 12 children, all of whom are in school. She has been working as a vendor since 1980. 55 years of age, she is seeking a loan to buy five cases of soft and alcoholic beverages. She plans to expand her business and provide for her children's studies. She praises the Lord and blesses Hekima for its support of low-income women.

loans.use: to buy five cases of soft and alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Chinyabuguma Group

texts.fr: Madame Cibalonza est conseillère de l’association d’affaire Chinyabuguma. Agée 64 enfants, elle est mariée à un vendeur de tôles et ensemble ils ont 3 enfants tous scolarisés.  Femme à grande vision, elle pratique le petit commerce il ya plus de 49 ans à partir de  fonds  reçu  de son mari. Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour acheter 7 tôles. Son vouloir est d’agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir  les femmes rurales dans le petit commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Cibalonza is the leader of the Chinyabuguma business association. She is 64 [years old]. Her husband is a vendor of sheet metal. They have three children, all in school. She is a woman who thinks big. She has been a vendor for over 49 years, having launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She is seeking this loan in order to buy seven sheets of metal. Her plan is to expand her business. She thanks Hekima for its support of female vendors in rural areas.

loans.use: to buy seven sheets of metal.

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Момагул верная жена и мать  троих детей. Ей 47 лет. Она занимается куплей и продажей мело рогатых скотин. Данной деятельностью Мамагул занята около 7 лет. Ей нравится ее работа.  У нее имеется среднее специальное образование, но из-за того она не нашла работу в селе, Момагул как и 60% населения занялась сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Сейчас из-за растущих расходов у Момагул проблемы с финансами. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На деньги от кредита Момагул намерена приобрести козлят и барашек, чтобы увеличить поголовья скотин.
texts.en: Momagul is a devoted wife and the mother of three. She is 47 years old. She buys and resells small livestock. She has been in this business for about seven years and enjoys her work. She has finished technical college, but was not able to find a job in her village. As 60% of the local population, Momagul started doing farm work. At present she is having financial difficulties due to growing expenses. This is why she is applying for a loan. Momagul plans to use her loan to increase her livestock headcount by buying goats and sheep.

loans.use: to buy small livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and purlins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and clean her plantings of coffee, corn, and beans
